# AI-Powered Daily Task Manager for Novated Lease Consultants

## Morning Routine (8:00-8:30 AM)

**AI Prompt for Morning Planning:**
```
Based on my CRM data, please generate:
1. A prioritized list of the top 10 clients needing follow-up today, sorted by:
   - Quotes awaiting decision (7+ days old)
   - Finance applications awaiting documentation (3+ days)
   - Approved deals awaiting settlement
   - New leads requiring initial contact
2. Flag any PHEV orders that need urgent attention due to March 31 deadline
3. Identify any lease quotes expiring within 7 days
4. Summarize my sales progress toward monthly targets
```

**Execute Morning Email Review:**
- Clear inbox from overnight
- Flag and categorize new inquiries
- Schedule callbacks for new leads

**Prepare Daily Focus List:**
1. Priority follow-ups (identified by AI)
2. Documentation collection tasks
3. Quote preparation requirements
4. Settlement processing needs

## Mid-Morning Productivity Block (9:00-11:00 AM)

**Focus on Outbound Communication:**
- Call new inquiries from overnight
- Follow up on 50% of pipeline by phone
- Document all conversation notes in CRM
- Send follow-up emails for any missed calls

**For Each Call, Complete:**
- Update CRM with current status
- Document any objections or concerns
- Schedule next follow-up date
- Request commitment (finance app or signed VSSS)

## Mid-Day Processing Block (11:00-3:00 PM)

**AI Prompt for Documentation Processing:**
```
Please review my pending documentation list and:
1. Generate customer-specific follow-up emails for missing documents
2. Create a checklist for each deal showing completion status
3. Flag any deals that are falling behind timeline expectations
4. Identify any potential compliance issues in submitted documentation
```

**Execute Documentation Processing:**
- Process customer requests
- Send finance applications from morning calls
- Process incoming deals
- Complete all admin and VDC requests

## Afternoon Follow-Up Block (3:00-4:00 PM)

**Contact Strategy:**
- Call any new inquiries
- Follow up on morning quotes
- Address questions on sent quotes
- Request commitment on each call

**AI Prompt for Objection Handling:**
```
Based on the following customer objections from today's calls:
[List objections]

Please generate:
1. Personalized talking points to address each objection
2. Value-based comparisons showing novated lease benefits
3. Next-step suggestions for each scenario to move the sale forward
```

## End-of-Day Wrap-Up (4:00-5:00 PM)

**AI Prompt for Performance Review:**
```
Based on today's activities, please:
1. Summarize key accomplishments and progress
2. Identify any tasks that weren't completed
3. Generate a prioritized list for tomorrow
4. Suggest optimization opportunities based on today's challenges
5. Calculate my current performance against targets
```

**Complete Administrative Tasks:**
- Process finance applications from afternoon calls
- Update all CRM records
- Schedule tomorrow's priorities
- Send any outstanding emails

## Weekly Planning (Friday Afternoon)

**AI Prompt for Weekly Review:**
```
Based on this week's performance data, please:
1. Analyze conversion rates at each stage of the sales process
2. Identify bottlenecks or areas for improvement
3. Compare aftermarket product attachment rates to targets
4. Calculate progress toward monthly goals
5. Generate recommendations for next week's focus areas
```

**Prepare for Next Week:**
- Review pipeline and prioritize early week activities
- Identify customers needing additional attention
- Plan follow-up strategy for aged leads
- Schedule important meetings and calls

# AI-Powered Email Template System for Novated Lease Consultants

## AI-Driven Email Strategy

This system provides structured prompts for generating highly effective, personalized customer communications throughout the novated lease sales process. Each template includes specific variables to customize and guidance on when to use each template type.

## Initial Contact Templates

### First-Time Novated Lease Inquiry

**When to use:** For leads who have expressed interest but have limited understanding of novated leasing.

```
Please create a personalized introduction email for [Customer Name] who works at [Employer] and has inquired about a novated lease for the first time. They are interested in a [Vehicle]. Include:

1. A warm introduction and confirmation of their inquiry
2. A brief, clear explanation of novated leasing (3-4 sentences maximum)
3. The top 3 benefits most relevant to their employer type
4. A clear call to action to schedule an initial consultation call
5. My contact information
```

### Specific Vehicle Inquiry

**When to use:** For leads with a specific vehicle in mind who need pricing information.

```
Please create a personalized response for [Customer Name] who has inquired about leasing a [Vehicle] through a novated arrangement. They work at [Employer] and earn approximately [Salary Range]. Include:

1. Acknowledgment of their specific vehicle interest
2. 2-3 sentences about the suitability of this vehicle for novated leasing
3. A question about their preferred lease term and annual kilometers
4. A clear next step to gather remaining information for a quote
5. My contact information
```

### PHEV/EV Specific Inquiry

**When to use:** For customers interested in a PHEV or EV, especially with the March 31, 2025 deadline approaching.

```
Please create a personalized response for [Customer Name] who has inquired about a PHEV/EV [Vehicle] through novated leasing. They work at [Employer]. Include:

1. Acknowledgment of their interest in this eco-friendly vehicle
2. Important information about the March 31, 2025 FBT exemption deadline
3. A brief explanation of the significant tax advantages available before this date
4. A sense of urgency regarding vehicle ordering timeframes
5. A clear call to action to proceed quickly to ensure eligibility
6. My contact information
```

## Quote Follow-Up Templates

### Initial Quote Presentation

**When to use:** When sending a freshly prepared quote to a customer.

```
Please create a personalized email for [Customer Name] to accompany their novated lease quote for a [Vehicle]. Their quote details include:
- Monthly payment: $[Amount]
- Lease term: [Years]
- Estimated annual tax saving: $[Amount]
- Residual value: $[Amount]

Include:
1. A friendly opening referencing our previous conversation
2. A brief explanation of the key financial benefits in their specific quote
3. Clear explanation of the next steps to proceed
4. Any time-sensitive information (quote validity, vehicle availability)
5. An offer to discuss any questions
6. My contact information
```

### Quote Follow-Up (No Response)

**When to use:** 3-5 days after sending a quote with no customer response.

```
Please create a follow-up email for [Customer Name] who received a novated lease quote for a [Vehicle] on [Date] but hasn't responded. Include:

1. A friendly check-in reference to the quote
2. A reminder of 1-2 key benefits specific to their situation
3. An acknowledgment that they may still be considering or have questions
4. A specific question to re-engage them (e.g., "Is there any specific aspect of the quote you'd like me to explain further?")
5. A gentle reminder of any time-sensitive elements
6. My contact information
```

### Objection Handling - Price Concerns

**When to use:** When a customer responds with concerns about the cost.

```
Please create a response for [Customer Name] who has expressed concerns about the monthly cost ($[Amount]) of their [Vehicle] novated lease quote. They specifically mentioned [Specific Concern]. Include:

1. Acknowledgment of their concern about cost
2. A clear breakdown comparing the novated lease cost vs. traditional financing
3. Emphasis on the tax advantages and bundled services
4. An offer to adjust terms (if possible) to better meet their budget
5. A suggestion for a brief call to discuss alternatives
6. My contact information
```

### Objection Handling - "Need to Think About It"

**When to use:** When a customer is hesitant and wants more time.

```
Please create a response for [Customer Name] who has said they need time to think about their [Vehicle] novated lease quote. Include:

1. Understanding and support for their need to carefully consider
2. Additional information that might help their decision process
3. Clarification of any potential timeline considerations (quote validity, price changes)
4. A value comparison showing long-term benefits
5. A non-pressuring offer to answer any specific questions
6. My contact information
```

## Documentation Process Templates

### Finance Application Instructions

**When to use:** When sending finance application forms to a customer.

```
Please create detailed instructions for [Customer Name] regarding their finance application for a [Vehicle] novated lease. Include:

1. A clear list of required documents (driver's license, payslips, etc.)
2. Specific guidance on completing the application correctly
3. Information about the approval timeline and process
4. Any employer-specific requirements
5. Next steps after submission
6. My contact information
```

### Missing Documentation Follow-Up

**When to use:** When following up on incomplete documentation.

```
Please create a follow-up email for [Customer Name] regarding their incomplete finance application for a [Vehicle]. They are missing [Specific Documents]. Include:

1. A friendly reminder about the missing documentation
2. Clear instructions for providing the required items
3. The impact of these documents on their application timeline
4. An offer to assist if they're having difficulty
5. A timeline for expected completion
6. My contact information
```

### Private Sale Documentation Guide

**When to use:** For customers pursuing a private sale novated lease.

```
Please create a comprehensive guide for [Customer Name] who is pursuing a private sale novated lease for a [Vehicle] priced at $[Amount]. Include:

1. A complete checklist of required documentation
2. Clear explanation of documentation needed from the seller
3. Explanation of the inspection requirements
4. Timeline expectations for the private sale process
5. Next steps after documentation collection
6. My contact information
```

## Aftermarket Product Templates

### Insurance Recommendation

**When to use:** When recommending comprehensive insurance.

```
Please create a personalized email for [Customer Name] recommending comprehensive insurance for their [Vehicle] valued at $[Amount]. Include:

1. The specific benefits of our insurance vs. standard policies
2. Emphasis on the gap protection for lease payout
3. A clear cost comparison showing the tax-effective price
4. The ease of inclusion in their salary packaging
5. A simple acceptance process
6. My contact information
```

### Premium Protection Package

**When to use:** When offering the complete vehicle protection package.

```
Please create a persuasive email for [Customer Name] recommending our Premium Protection Package for their new [Vehicle]. Include:

1. Congratulations on their new vehicle selection
2. The components of the protection package (exterior/interior protection, tint, etc.)
3. The specific benefits for their vehicle type
4. The convenience of bundling with their lease
5. The limited-time Driver Safety Kit offer
6. A simple acceptance process
7. My contact information
```

## Settlement and Delivery Templates

### Approval Confirmation

**When to use:** When notifying a customer of finance approval.

```
Please create an exciting approval notification for [Customer Name] whose finance for a [Vehicle] has been approved. Include:

1. Congratulations on their approval
2. Clear next steps in the settlement process
3. Timeline for expected documentation and delivery
4. Any actions required from them at this stage
5. Expression of appreciation for their business
6. My contact information
```

### Delivery Coordination

**When to use:** When coordinating vehicle delivery details.

```
Please create a delivery coordination email for [Customer Name] whose [Vehicle] is ready for delivery on [Date]. Include:

1. Confirmation of delivery details (date, time, location)
2. Any identification or documentation they should bring
3. Information about the delivery inspection process
4. Initial vehicle operation guidance
5. Post-delivery support information
6. My contact information
```

## Post-Settlement Templates

### Welcome and Onboarding

**When to use:** After vehicle delivery to welcome the customer.

```
Please create a welcome email for [Customer Name] who has just taken delivery of their [Vehicle]. Include:

1. Congratulations and welcome to SG Fleet
2. Overview of their online account access
3. Key contacts for different service needs
4. Brief explanation of how to use fuel cards, maintenance services
5. Information about their first payment date
6. My contact information and invitation for any questions
```

### Satisfaction Check-In

**When to use:** 2-4 weeks after delivery to check on satisfaction.

```
Please create a check-in email for [Customer Name] who took delivery of their [Vehicle] on [Date]. Include:

1. A friendly inquiry about their experience with the vehicle
2. Confirmation that their salary packaging is operating correctly
3. Reminder of how to access services (fuel, maintenance)
4. Request for feedback on the overall process
5. Invitation to refer colleagues (if appropriate)
6. My contact information
```

import React, { useState } from 'react'; const ProductRecommendationTool = () => { const [customerData, setCustomerData] = useState({ vehicleValue: 50000, vehicleType: 'sedan', hasChildren: false, primaryUse: 'commuting', riskAversion: 'moderate', budgetSensitivity: 'moderate', parkingLocation: 'covered', annualKilometers: 20000, employmentSector: 'private' }); const [recommendations, setRecommendations] = useState(null); // Handle input changes const handleInputChange = (e) => { const { name, value, type, checked } = e.target; setCustomerData({ ...customerData, [name]: type === 'checkbox' ? checked : value }); }; // Generate personalized recommendations const generateRecommendations = () => { // Core product recommendations const core = []; const recommended = []; const optional = []; // Motor Insurance is always core core.push({ id: 'motorInsurance', name: 'Motor Insurance', monthlyEst: Math.round(customerData.vehicleValue * 0.0035), reason: 'Essential protection with full lease payout coverage' }); // Employment sector affects LeaseGuard recommendation if (customerData.employmentSector === 'private' || customerData.employmentSector === 'contract') { recommended.push({ id: 'leaseGuard', name: 'LeaseGuard', monthlyEst: 80, reason: `Recommended for ${customerData.employmentSector} sector employees to protect against redundancy` }); } else { optional.push({ id: 'leaseGuard', name: 'LeaseGuard', monthlyEst: 80, reason: 'Optional protection against employment changes' }); } // Vehicle value affects Minor Damage Repair recommendation if (customerData.vehicleValue > 40000) { recommended.push({ id: 'minorDamageRepair', name: 'Minor Damage Repair', monthlyEst: 40, reason: 'Recommended for higher value vehicles to maintain appearance and value' }); } else { optional.push({ id: 'minorDamageRepair', name: 'Minor Damage Repair', monthlyEst: 40, reason: 'Optional protection for minor cosmetic damage' }); } // Environmental consciousness if (customerData.vehicleType === 'hybrid' || customerData.vehicleType === 'electric') { recommended.push({ id: 'carbonOffset', name: 'Carbon Offset', monthlyEst: 25, reason: 'Aligns with your choice of eco-friendly vehicle' }); } else { optional.push({ id: 'carbonOffset', name: 'Carbon Offset', monthlyEst: 25, reason: 'Optional environmental impact reduction' }); } // Roadside assistance based on kilometers and risk aversion if (customerData.annualKilometers > 15000 || customerData.riskAversion === 'high') { recommended.push({ id: 'roadside', name: 'Roadside Assistance', monthlyEst: 15, reason: `Recommended due to your ${customerData.annualKilometers > 15000 ? 'high annual mileage' : 'preference for security'}` }); } else { optional.push({ id: 'roadside', name: 'Roadside Assistance', monthlyEst: 15, reason: 'Optional emergency support on the road' }); } // Window tint based on vehicle type and parking if (customerData.vehicleType === 'suv' || customerData.vehicleType === 'wagon' || customerData.hasChildren) { recommended.push({ id: 'windowTint', name: 'Window Tint', oneTimeEst: 450, monthlyEst: Math.round(450 / 36), reason: `Recommended for ${customerData.hasChildren ? 'families with children' : 'larger vehicles'} to reduce heat and UV exposure` }); } else { optional.push({ id: 'windowTint', name: 'Window Tint', oneTimeEst: 450, monthlyEst: Math.round(450 / 36), reason: 'Optional UV and heat protection' }); } // Exterior protection based on parking location and vehicle value if (customerData.parkingLocation === 'street' || customerData.vehicleValue > 60000) { recommended.push({ id: 'exteriorProtection', name: 'Exterior Protection', oneTimeEst: 795, monthlyEst: Math.round(795 / 36), reason: `Recommended due to ${customerData.parkingLocation === 'street' ? 'exposure to elements' : 'high vehicle value'}` }); } else { optional.push({ id: 'exteriorProtection', name: 'Exterior Protection', oneTimeEst: 795, monthlyEst: Math.round(795 / 36), reason: 'Optional paint protection and appearance enhancement' }); } // Interior protection based on having children or primary use if (customerData.hasChildren || customerData.primaryUse === 'family') { recommended.push({ id: 'interiorProtection', name: 'Interior Protection', oneTimeEst: 695, monthlyEst: Math.round(695 / 36), reason: 'Recommended for families to protect against spills and stains' }); } else { optional.push({ id: 'interiorProtection', name: 'Interior Protection', oneTimeEst: 695, monthlyEst: Math.round(695 / 36), reason: 'Optional interior stain and wear protection' }); } // Dash cam based on primary use and kilometers if (customerData.primaryUse === 'business' || customerData.annualKilometers > 25000) { recommended.push({ id: 'dashCam', name: 'Dash Cam', oneTimeEst: 695, monthlyEst: Math.round(695 / 36), reason: `Recommended for ${customerData.primaryUse === 'business' ? 'business use' : 'high mileage drivers'}` }); } else { optional.push({ id: 'dashCam', name: 'Dash Cam', oneTimeEst: 695, monthlyEst: Math.round(695 / 36), reason: 'Optional video evidence and security' }); } // Set recommendations state with all categories setRecommendations({ core, recommended, optional }); }; // Calculate total costs const calculateTotals = (products) => { if (!products) return { monthly: 0, oneTime: 0 }; return products.reduce( (acc, product) => ({ monthly: acc.monthly + product.monthlyEst, oneTime: acc.oneTime + (product.oneTimeEst || 0) }), { monthly: 0, oneTime: 0 } ); }; return (

name: Scripts and Templates
description: Create a series of Phone scripts and email templates that I can use on a daily basis to save time typing each one and to give me accurate prompts and scripts to use during a phone call.
prompt_template:
Thoroughly analyse the attached files, as well as the project knowledge, and create a well formatted and systematically categorised, highly structured series of email templates. Ensure the wording is highly compliant with the strict regulations around specific topics such as those of, what we can and can't say when discussing "leaseGuard." ensure the structure is incredibly well formatted to provide a systematic filing method to store and save each template. Then, I also want you to provide equally as well categorised and structured series of phone scripts that I can open and read should I face any questions i am unsure on. keep the phone scripts concise, removing the small talk and unnesseccary parts. They are "prompts" not to be read word-for-word

 PS this will eventually be integrated into an app that i am building, just incase that changes anything. If you do not need to change anything due to that information, then please disregard and continue as you were

docs.filename: CBA Miles- Non Dealer Sale Checklistv4.pdf
docs.content:
NON-DEALER SALE CHECKLIST – CBA Miles
Document Classification: Confidential
Private Sale or Company Sale (not GST Registered) – Driver purchases a vehicle privately off of another individual – via
car sales, out of paper etc…
□ Registration Papers
□ PPSR
□ Inspection Report stamped by a mechanical workshop showing ABN (required if purchase price is over $60k)
□ Valid Payout Letter (if financed)
□ Invoice signed by Vendor
□ Copy of original tax invoice & proof of payment from Vendor (Receipts) OR Stat Dec signed by Vendor
□ Statement by Supplier signed by Vendor
□ Vendor Bank details if disbursement to the Vendor is required (in the form of a bank statement)
□ Driver Bank details if on roads are payable (in the form of a bank statement)
□ Vendor’s D.O.B for CBA to perform a Suitable Supplier Check (Vendor Wash)
□ Current Odometer Reading (captured at time of quote)
Sale & Leaseback – Driver owns the vehicle outright (no finance owing) and wishes to lease the vehicle back to themselves.
□ Registration Papers
□ PPSR (showing clear title)
□ Inspection Report stamped by a mechanical workshop showing ABN (required if purchase price is over $60k)
□ Copy of original tax invoice & proof of payment (Receipts) OR Stat Dec signed by the driver.
□ Invoice
□ Statement by Supplier
□ Driver Bank Details (in the form of a bank statement)
□ Current Odometer Reading (captured at time of quote)
Payout to another Financier – Driver has their vehicle financed through another financier and wishes to payout that
contract to lease back via sgfleet.
□ Registration Papers
□ PPSR
□ Valid Payout Letter
□ Statement by Supplier.
□ Invoice
□ Driver Bank Details (in the form of a bank statement, if disbursement is required)
□ Current Odometer Reading (captured at time of quote)
Company Sale (GST Registered) – Driver purchases a vehicle from a company/organisation.
Please note; all documentation to be signed by the Vendor, must be signed by someone authorised e.g. Director or CEO.
□ PPSR
□ Registration Papers
□ Inspection Report stamped by a mechanical workshop showing ABN (required if purchase price is over $60k)
□ Tax Invoice (if the company is registered for GST ensuring disbursements are outlined if vehicle is financed)
□ Vendor Bank Details (in the form of a bank statement if payment to the company is applicable)
□ Payout Letter (if financed)
□ Copy of original tax invoice & proof of payment (Receipts) OR Stat Dec signed by Vendor (If vehicle is NOT financed)
□ Driver Bank details if on roads are payable (in the form of a bank statement)
□ Current Odometer Reading (captured at time of quote)
□ Statement by Supplier.

1
The Script (PRIVATE SALE - Vendor/Seller)
Admin
:
Vendor:
Admin:
Vendor:
Admin:
Vendor
Good morning/afternoon, am I speaking with (Vendor’s Name).
Yes
Hi (
Vendor name),this is (your name) from
 SG Fleet's sales admin team. Do you have a minute to
discuss the next steps for sales of your (make model) to (driver first name)?
Yes
We have received the file from (Sales Consultant) and will now issue the finance documentation
and arrange payment with the financier to you.
The purpose of this call is to briefly take you through the final steps.
Before we go any further, I need to advise our calls are recorded for quality and training purposes.
Is that ok?
Yes
Thank you.
If there is a payout
The current payout letter I have expires XX/XX, in order to make this date please try to have the
paperwork back to me 3- 4 business days before the expiry date as a minimum.
I will be sending you an email shortly, attached will be the finance contracts to be reviewed and
signed for the financier. Any aditional items they require will be noted in the body of the email.
Once completed we will proceed to process funding authorisation and payment.
*If you dont have DOB get this over the phone and adjust wording above that the email will be
sent after they are setup in the system as a supplier and that this might take 24 hours.
Admin:
Once I have received your signed documents and approval conditions we will submit for funding
authorisation which takes about 24 hours. The settlements team will then activate the file,
payment will be processed in a 24-48 period. A remittance will be issued to show the payment has
been made.
Was there any questions that I can answer for you at this point in time?
Thank you for our time and I look forward in receiving your documents.
End call.

docs.content:
Script -- Refinance Document Chasing

**Jan 2024**

The Script

Sales Support: *Good morning/afternoon, am I speaking with (Drivers'
Name).*

*Driver:* Yes

Sales Support: Hi (Driver name), this is (sales admin name) from
**sg**fleet. I am helping (Sales Consultants Name) and have issued out
your finance documents for execution to finalise your refinance. Is this
a convenient time to speak to you about the next steps?

Driver Yes

Sales Support: I do need to inform you the call is recorded for quality
and training purposes. Before I discuss any specifics for your lease, I
need to perform a security check, can you please confirm your full name,
date of birth and residential address.

Driver: Driver to confirm

Sales Support: Thank you.

eDOCS Your contracts have been sent to (email XXXXXXXX) and utilised 2
step authentication and DocuSign. Can you please confirm that is the
best email and you have access to this mobile to receive the code.

Driver: Yes

Email Docs (CBA/Autonomy)

I have sent you an email to (email XXXXXXXX), attached are your novated
lease contracts that you will be required to sign and return. Although
the instructions in the email are clear, please take note that called
out in the email is where we do or do not require documents to be dated.

> Some documents cannot be dated as the dates will align with your lease
> commencement date; this will be completed by our settlements team.
>
> If you are wet signing, please ensure your signature matches that of
> your driver's licence. When scanning and emailing back we cannot
> accept the single signed pages.

Sales Support: The documents may have been sent to your spam or junk
folder. Please check there as well if you don't receive them in the next
few hours.

> *I have also sent you an email noting any additional information or
> approval conditions from the financier* **(only if applicable)** -- at
> this stage you will know if they have any conditions -- read through
> the below regarding CID or move on to DA).
>
> ***\*If approval condition\****
>
> To satisfy the bank's approval condition, we require a certified copy
> of your Australian Driver's Licence. Please refer to the email for
> instructions on how to obtain a certified copy.
>
> We have your residential address as XXXXXXX. Is this the same as on
> the driver's licence?

Driver: Yes

> No (please request a utility bill/rates notice/rental agreement
> reflecting the same address as on the document)

**Delegated**

**Authority (DA) YES -** Once you have signed the documents, we will
have the Novation Agreement signed by sgfleet as we have Delegated
Authority.

> OR
>
> **NO -** Once you have signed the documents, we will have the Novation
> Agreement signed by your Employer. When this is returned to us, we
> will sign and finalise the documents.
>
> [(EXCEPTION NSW Police and Department of Defence)]{.mark}

Sales Support: Do you have any questions at this point?

Driver: No

VDC: Our contact details are at the bottom of the email. Should you have
any questions as you work through the documents, please do not hesitate
to contact the Sales Admin Team. Your residual due date is XX/XX if you
can ensure the contracts are returned 2 weeks prior where possible.

> Thank you for your time and I look forward in receiving your
> documents. Have a great day!
>
> End call.

**How to run 6 month RV Process, lead creation and allocation and create
file for Marketing**

Login to EVO and select Admin

![](media/image1.png){width="3.673530183727034in"
height="2.2677766841644793in"}

Then RV Process will appear, click on this

![](media/image2.png){width="3.723758748906387in"
height="2.4779451006124233in"}

Channel should be set to sgfleet -- Novated RV

Open and Termination Product Date set to the last day of the month you
are wanting to run and click Search

![](media/image3.png){width="10.529095581802276in"
height="2.9618186789151357in"}

The search will give you a total number of Products, these are the
number of lines to be checked to create the lead or exclude.

On the left the circle can be selected to highlight the line to keep
your place

If a lead already exists it will show in the first column, these you
need to check and if they are the RV lead update the lead if logged
incorrectly and untick the selected box on the right so a new lead is
not created.

You will need to check the EFM Person and Client columns to ensure they
match, if the clients are different you may have to manually generate
the lead.

![](media/image4.png){width="10.916574803149606in"
height="4.344510061242345in"}

One you have run down the page and unticked any you are not wanting to
create leads for click the Save Select/Exclude at the bottom of the page

![](media/image5.png){width="10.437777777777777in"
height="1.4513101487314086in"}

On the next page you have the option to select one or more team members
for VIP leads

The Quota number needs to be updated so that the total adds up to the
total number of leads

Once finished click the Save Quota and Allocate at the bottom of the
page

![](media/image6.png){width="10.123496281714786in"
height="3.9914107611548557in"}

The next page will show you the list to be created with consultant, you
can change the consultants at this stage if required

![](media/image7.png){width="8.32908573928259in"
height="3.2763517060367455in"}

NOTE: Roll of clients will need to be checked at this step and adjusted
if required

At the bottom pf the page you will see a tally of the leads that are
going to be allocated by person

![](media/image8.png){width="4.346540901137358in"
height="2.6544936570428694in"}

You can at this stage Save OR Save and Create Leads (**IF YOU DO THIS
THERE IS NO GOING BACK**), this will create the leads in EVO and the
marking file.

![](media/image9.png){width="5.354765966754155in"
height="6.9154702537182855in"}

![](media/image10.png){width="10.693055555555556in"
height="4.146527777777778in"}

Allocation Rules:

#1 Client Config Dedicated Refinance Consultants

#2 VIP Persons (if VIP consultants exists)

#3 Orphans (3^rd^ Party Funded)

#4 Under \$11k (so \$11k goes to next one)

#5 Aggregate Term = months between first lease start date and residual
due date, segregated into 0-35, 36-71, 72+ term groups, then allocated
to different random round robin consultant cycles per group.

Novated Sales Support
Key Performance Indicators (KPI)
Support Admin / Coordinators
Sep 2024

Key Performance Indicators – Sales Support Admin/Coordinators 
Page 2 of 3
Pipeline Management
New Deal Assigned – Documentation Process
Effective communication is crucial for the successful management of each customer. The following KPi’s cover the
initial steps of engagement with your customers.
The below Mandatory tasks must be completed within 6 Business Hours of the deal being assigned to the admin
team.
• File review
• Familiarize yourself with the deal at hand checking employee and finance data
o Supplier setup for non dealer sales
o Name, address, DOB, payroll number, approval conditions
• Initiate eDocs / Email Documents and request for additional information
• To be completed within 6 buisness hours of file allocation
• Relevant notes to be entered into IMS/CRM/MILES
Ongoing Deal Management
To ensure a positive experience for the Customer and to ensure you remain in control of the transaction,
regular and consistent updates and confirmations are necessary.
• Customer correspondence, via phone or email, must be responded to within KPI timeframes
noted below:
• Emails into shared and personal inbox - < 6 buisness hours
• If returning a call and cannot leave a voicemail message (follow up with an email) - 6 buisness
hours
• Relevant notes to be entered into IMS/CRM - at time of actioning
• Documentation execution by all parties - average < 3 buisness days
• 48 hours after documentation is issued if not on step 2 (employer) or received in inbox follow
up via phone call to employee
• Relevant notes to be entered into IMS/CRM/MILES
• If initial contact attempt is unsuccessful, follow up with email and 2nd call attempt 48 hrs later
• Employer sign off follow up if via email 2 buisness days after request if not returned, eDocs to
be managed in tracker and ranks utalised where possible
o Company specific exceptions to be adhered to, escialtion after 1 follow up after 2

Key Performance Indicators – Sales Support Admin/Coordinators Page 3 of 3
File Completion
• Documentation and Approval Conditions
• Completed file will contain correctly executed novated lease documentation, signed by all relevant
parties
o Data on Privacy (CBA) and Direct Debit to be checked
• Approval conditions such as certified drivers license to be correct completed and attached to file
• Valid finance approval
• Valid payout tax invoice (for refinance)
• Miles dates populated
• Correct dates captured in the LTC documents sent and receiver fields
• IMS/CRM to be in correct workflow status
• File/case to be in correct status
buisness days to novated.client@sgfleet.com

Document Classification: Confidential
Important Information – Westpac Employee Requirement
Thank you for choosing SG Fleet as your novated lease provider.
As part of the facilitation of the novated leasing program within Westpac, your employer requires you to
have a salary packaging account with Smart Salary to facilitate the delivery of your new vehicle.
Who is Smart Salary?
Smart Salary manages all salary packaging deductions on behalf of Westpac and will remit your salary
deductions to SG Fleet for your novated lease vehicle.
What do I need to do?
Already have a Smart Salary account?
Great, you’re all set and can proceed with finalising your vehicle delivery.
Still need to set up your Smart Salary account?
To set up your salary packaging account, simply follow these steps:
1. Contact Smart Salary at customersupport@smartsalary.com.au
2. Request a salary packaging application form: In your email, mention you are a Westpac
employee and require a Salary Packaging Application form for your SG Fleet Novated Lease.
3. Complete the application form and submit it with a copy of your latest payslip to Smart Salary.
Questions?
If you have any questions regarding the salary packaging application process, please contact Smart
Salary customer support at 1300 476 278.
If you have any questions or need more information regarding your SG Fleet Novated Lease, please call
us on 1300 138 235 or email novatedservices@sgfleet.com.
Thank you for choosing to package your vehicle with SG Fleet.
Kind regards
SG Fleet Team

| |                  |                                              |   |

|                                                                       |

|     by mail within 7-10 business days. If you need to fill up before  |

End call.

Driver purchase a vehicle from a company or Organisation.
When you get the file the first step is to check the rego. If the vehicle is registered in the company
name or the Payout is addressed to a company, this will be a company sale.
You will follow the standard checklist plus the additional steps.

• Call to obtain their ABN

• Bank statement for disbursement (if applicable)
• Valid Payout if applicable
• Current odometer reading
If the seller is not the Director/Owner or CEO of the company, you can either ask him/her for
the contact details or liaise with the seller.
Bank account takes 24 hour to open – must receive a bank statement as soon as possible.

10
Private Sale with Finance Payout
Definition:
A private sale is negotiated between a buyer and a seller directly. In a private sale brokers and agents
are absent. The sale is made voluntarily between the individual parties.
Before you start, select the correct Non Dealer checklist to familiarise yourself with the additional
requirements and documents that has to be prepared for a Private Sale with a Payout.
The Checklist can be located here:
\\prod\dfs\Departments\Novated Sales\Sales Support Team\3. Training and Resources\Non Dealer
Sale
Example checklist with CBA as the financier

11
Please note the different documents required for a GST Payout and a Non GST Payout for
Ensure to select the correct one.
If it is a GST Payout the financier will issue a Tax Invoice and not a Payout letter
Eg: Lease Plan will issue a Tax Invocie and not a Payout letter
Step 1
PPSR Check
• Check the PPSR search to confirm the vehicle has not been recorded as Stolen or written
off and the encumbrance matches the Payout. If the vehicle has been recorded as Stolen or
Written off, please return to sales consultant
Step 2
Payout Letter or Tax Invoice
 The payout figure must be equal or lower than the Dealer Purchase Price.
If the Payout Letter/Tax Invoice is higher than the List Price Including GST (Sale Price) the
Vendor has to make a payment to pay the due amount “down” equal to or less than the agreed
amount and supply a new Payout Letter (Dealer Purchase Price) If the new payout figure is less than
the Dealer Purchase Price, the difference will be disburse to the Seller.
Step 3
On roads to Driver
Driver must supply a bank statement, this should be on file already and include:
o Logo and name of bank
o Drivers name and address
o BSB number
o Account number
Registration Papers
If there is a payout letter, registration papers are not required, unless it is an approval condition. The Payout
letter will include the Vehicle Identifiers – Vin and Engine Number as well as the registration number.
Disbursements:
A Bank Statement must be obtained from Driver and/or Vendor and send to Settlement to open the
Bank account as soon as you have the information. They can also use the singed Direct Debit form
from the driver. This takes 24 hours to open.
Private Sale with no Finance Payout
The same steps will apply with only the following exceptions:
• Registration documents will be required showing the Vin and Engine number and registered owner/
operator.
• PPSR must clear of any encumbrances as we will pay the full sell price to the Vendor

14
Sale & Leaseback
Definition of a Sale and Leaseback
Driver owns the vehicle outright (No finance owing) and wishes to lease the vehicle back to
themselves.
Before you start, select the correct Non Dealer checklist to familiarise yourself with the additional
requirements and documents that has to be prepared for a Sale and Leaseback
The check list can be located here:
\\prod\dfs\Departments\Novated Sales\Sales Support Team\3. Training and Resources\Non
Dealer Sale
Example checklist with CBA as the financier
Step 1
PPSR Check
• Check the PPSR on file to confirm the vehicle has not been recorded as Stolen or
written off and If the vehicle has been recorded as Stolen or Written off, please refer back
to sales consultant
• PPSR must clear of any encumbrances
Registration Papers
Registration documents are required showing the Driver as the owner/operator. A Registration
Renewal will not be suffice if it does not show the Vin and Engine number
Disbursements:
A Bank Statement must be obtained from Driver and/or Vendor and send to Settlement to open the
Bank account as soon as you have the information. They can also use the singed Direct Debit form
from the driver. This takes 24 hours to open.

17
If a vehicle is encumbered, the vendor is who the finance is under. Registration papers only show
operator. However in the instance of NO finance, the Vendor is who the vehicle is registered to.
EG: Payout letter is Joe Block and registration papers indicates Jane Citizen. Joe Block will be the
Vendor.

New Ticket = Novated Vehicle Order

Assign Order:\
![](media/image1.png){width="7.089838145231846in"
height="4.755360892388452in"}

![](media/image2.png){width="6.404241032370954in"
height="3.7789709098862643in"}

Once assigned ticket will sit in INTRO/ORDER status, Vehicle Ordered
will be the first step via the workflow

![](media/image3.png){width="6.406591207349082in"
height="4.328316929133858in"}

At order a pop up screen will ask for Payment Terms

![](media/image4.png){width="5.101058617672791in"
height="4.447742782152231in"}

Availability (if not already in AUNEM), set next action due and advised
delivery date (if known)

![](media/image5.png){width="4.8605741469816275in"
height="3.722706692913386in"}

When order acceptance is received select Order Confirmed

![](media/image6.png){width="7.3929133858267715in"
height="5.121636045494313in"}

Pop up with supplier payment terms and advised delivery date are
mandatory at this point

![](media/image7.png){width="7.176773840769903in"
height="4.2165332458442695in"}

Once allocated to the VDC, Intro Call to be completed and marked off.

![](media/image8.png){width="7.4125831146106735in"
height="4.286913823272091in"}

Set next action due date and update EDD if required

![](media/image9.png){width="6.268055555555556in"
height="4.040972222222222in"}

Status will now move into the DOCUMENT phase.

Documents sent to be marked off when issued to customer.

![](media/image10.png){width="7.065044838145232in"
height="5.223249125109361in"}

Once fully executed documents come back mark off Documents Completed

![](media/image11.png){width="5.155136701662292in"
height="4.128792650918635in"}

To submit for final funding select the Request Funding Approval

![](media/image12.png){width="5.448068678915136in"
height="5.114882983377078in"}

A settlement officer will pick up the file and send to the bank then
mark off Funding Approved

![](media/image13.png){width="6.268055555555556in"
height="5.597916666666666in"}

Once you have the dealer and ARB invoice where required mark off Invoice
Received

![](media/image14.png){width="5.984114173228346in"
height="5.282011154855643in"}

A pop up will then ask you to confirm the payment terms and advised
delivery date

![](media/image15.png){width="6.268055555555556in"
height="4.413194444444445in"}

The ticket will then progress into the DELIVERY status

After delivery or prior if you require funding mark off Rego/CTP and
attach document

![](media/image16.png){width="5.07588145231846in"
height="4.71154636920385in"}

Set the file ready for settlement

![](media/image17.png){width="3.953162729658793in"
height="4.572459536307962in"}

Settlement officer will pick up the AUPTR and either mark as Incomplete
and it will return to previous status, or complete and assign themselves
as the settlement officer to complete activation

![](media/image18.png){width="4.100699912510936in"
height="4.865321522309712in"}

File Complete:

![](media/image19.png){width="6.268055555555556in"
height="5.249305555555556in"}

Ticket will move to SETTLEMENT status

Once contract is activated in Miles ticket will be updated

![](media/image20.png){width="6.268055555555556in"
height="4.097222222222222in"}

Activation date entered in ticket

![](media/image21.png){width="6.268055555555556in"
height="4.269444444444445in"}

MILES LTC then sync'd to EFM and marked off in ticket

![](media/image22.png){width="4.837360017497812in"
height="5.481556211723534in"}

NOCC or PVA emailed and marked off in ticket, Final Schedule also to be
emailed

![](media/image23.png){width="6.268055555555556in"
height="7.545138888888889in"}

Note added that PVA/NOCC sent

![](media/image24.png){width="5.168035870516185in"
height="3.391918197725284in"}

![](media/image25.png){width="6.205774278215223in"
height="6.229150262467192in"}

Ticket will then move to POST DELIVERY status, for post delivery call to
be competed and VDC mark off

![](media/image26.png){width="4.678327865266842in"
height="5.98241469816273in"}

VDC can then resolve ticket

    Novation after making my own inquiries in relation to the commercial
    and financial risks arising from the Lease Novation.

2.  I acknowledge that I have relied on my own legal, financial and
    taxation advice in relation to the Lease Novation documentation and
    that I have not relied on any information supplied to me by the
    ***ASC Pty Ltd*** or their officers or employees.

3.  I acknowledge that ***ASC Pty Ltd*** has entered (or will enter)
    into the Lease Novation at my request and I understand that many of
    the obligations pursuant to my Lease Agreement with **SG Fleet**,
    including without limitation my obligation to make lease rental
    payments, are assumed by ***ASC Pty Ltd*** under the Lease Novation.

4.  In consideration of the ***ASC Pty Ltd*** entering into the Lease
    Novation:

```{=html}
<!-- -->
```
(a) in respect of all matters I will unconditionally and irrevocably
    > indemnify ***ASC Pty Ltd*** against any and all losses, damages,
    > costs, charges, expenses or taxes (including but not limited to
    > Fringe Benefits Tax) whatsoever and howsoever arising which ***ASC
    > Pty Ltd*** may sustain, incur, or suffer whether directly or
    > indirectly, as a result of or in connection with:

```{=html}
<!-- -->
```
(i) any obligation assumed by ***ASC Pty Ltd*** as a result of the lease
    > of the Vehicle or under any document relating to the lease of the
    > Vehicle, including without limitation the Lease Agreement and
    > Lease Novation;

(ii) any breach of this document by me or on my behalf;

(iii) the Vehicle; or

(iv) the sale, transfer, or disposal of the Vehicle.

```{=html}
<!-- -->
```
(b) I will pay to ***ASC Pty Ltd*** on demand the amount of losses,
    > damages, costs, charges, expenses or taxes referred to in clause
    > 3(b) and hereby authorise ***ASC Pty Ltd*** to deduct such amounts
    > from my salary.

```{=html}
<!-- -->
```
5.  I acknowledge and agree that this document is a continuing
    indemnity, may be enforced by ***ASC Pty Ltd*** before and without
    first incurring any expense or making any payment to any person and
    survives the termination of the Lease Novation. I acknowledge that
    my liability under this document will not be prejudiced by:

```{=html}
<!-- -->
```
(a) the granting to any person of any time or other indulgence,
    > consideration or concession;

(b) any other guarantee or security taken or held at any time by ***ASC
    > Pty Ltd*** or the release or unenforceability of such a guarantee
    > or security;

(c) the amount of any losses, damages, costs, charges, expenses or taxes
    > (including but not limited to Fringe Benefits Tax) referred to in
    > clause 3(b) not being recoverable from any other person; or

(d) any matter which, but for this provision, could or might operate to
    > affect or discharge my liability under this document.

```{=html}
<!-- -->
```
6.  I acknowledge and agree that I will comply with all reasonable
    directions given to me by the ASC Pty Ltd (including pursuant to
    relevant policies) in relation to the Vehicle or the Lease Novation.

7.  I acknowledge and agree that during the course of the Lease Novation
    I will comply with all terms and conditions as set out in the
    relevant lease documentation (including the Lease Novation) as if
    the obligations of ***ASC Pty Ltd*** were my obligations.

8.  I hereby direct ***ASC Pty Ltd*** to deduct from my salary all
    monies payable by ASC Pty Ltd to **SG Fleet** in respect of the
    Lease Novation and Lease Agreement (including under clause 16 of
    this Deed).

9.  I acknowledge that where, during the course of the Lease Novation, I
    take unpaid leave, I will be responsible for all obligations
    pursuant to any covenant, liability or responsibility under the
    Lease Agreement and the Lease Novation, including without limitation
    the obligation to make lease rental payments.

10. If during the course of the Lease Novation there is a reduction in
    the amount of my remuneration and I am no longer able to finance the
    Lease Novation remuneration allocation under my salary sacrifice
    arrangement, then I agree that I will be responsible for all
    obligations pursuant to any covenant, liability or responsibility
    under the Lease Agreement or the Lease Novation, including without
    limitation the obligations to make lease rental repayments.

11. In relation to any liability which arises pursuant to the Lease
    Novation or in connection with the Vehicle, where that liability
    arises after the termination of either my employment with ***ASC Pty
    Ltd*** or termination of the Lease Novation (for any reason):

```{=html}
<!-- -->
```
(a) I agree that I am responsible to meet that liability; and

(b) I indemnify ***ASC Pty Ltd*** from any loss, damage, costs, charges,
    > expenses or taxes which ***ASC Pty Ltd*** might suffer or incur as
    > a result of me not meeting that liability.

```{=html}
<!-- -->
```
12. I undertake to use the **SG Fleet** fuel and maintenance card issued
    to me in connection with the Vehicle for fuel and repairs and
    maintenance purchases only and will cease using and return that **SG
    Fleet** fuel and maintenance card to ***ASC Pty Ltd*** Group
    Taxation Accountant immediately upon becoming aware of the impending
    termination of either my employment with ***ASC Pty Ltd*** or
    termination of the Lease Novation (for any reason).

13. I agree that all fees and charges incurred by ***ASC Pty Ltd*** in
    connection with the Lease Novation will be debited to my Novated
    Lease Account. These fees and charges may include (but are not
    limited to) administration fees, service fees for the provision of
    the **SG Fleet** fuel and maintenance card, an early termination
    fee, a documentation procurement fee and expense reimbursement fees
    payable by ***ASC Pty Ltd*** to **SG Fleet** pursuant to **SG
    Fleet**'s terms and conditions.

14. I undertake to ensure that all Vehicle registration and Vehicle
    insurance policy renewals and associated documentation that are sent
    to me are forwarded to **SG Fleet** promptly for processing or paid
    by me. In addition, I agree that it is my responsibility to ensure
    that the Vehicle registration and insurance policy are current at
    all times.

15. I acknowledge and agree that on termination of my **SG Fleet**
    novated motor vehicle lease due to my cessation of employment with
    ***ASC Pty Ltd*** that the following items must be provided to
    ***ASC Pty Ltd*** by no later than my last day of service:

```{=html}
<!-- -->
```
a.  vehicle **SG Fleet** fuel and maintenance cards;

b.  odometer reading; and

c.  signed transfer of registration **(applicable only where vehicle
    registration in the name of ASC Pty Ltd**

> If the above requirements are not fulfilled I acknowledge and agree
> that a contingency of \$500 will be deducted from my final salary
> payment and retained by ***ASC Pty Ltd*** as a genuine pre-estimate of
> ***ASC Pty Ltd's*** damages if the items are not returned. The
> contingency will be returned to me upon meeting the above
> requirements.

16. I acknowledge that a contingency of \$500 will be retained by **SG
    Fleet** on termination of my **SG Fleet** novated motor vehicle
    lease arrangement as a result of my cessation of employment with
    ***ASC Pty Ltd*** and authorise **ASC Pty Ltd** to deduct the \$500
    from my salary and pay it to **SG Fleet** on my behalf. I understand
    and acknowledge that this \$500 contingency is for the payment of
    any outstanding costs resulting from my **SG Fleet** novated motor
    vehicle lease and any refund of the contingency amount is subject to
    **SG Fleet**'s final reconciliation completed in the month following
    the month of termination of my lease.

17. I consent to *ASC Pty Ltd* providing to **SG Fleet** such
    information as **SG Fleet** may require in connection with the Lease
    Agreement including my:

```{=html}
<!-- -->
```
a)  full name and residential address;

b)  work e-mail address;

c)  gross remuneration;

d)  frequency of pay roll (e.g. fortnightly);

e)  position held;

f)  length of employment with *ASC Pty Ltd*; and

g)  duration of employment contract with *ASC Pty Ltd*.

Executed as a deed poll

Signed, sealed and delivered by (employee name)
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

On this day of
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Signature

Witness signature
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Document Classification: Confidential
Important Information – Westpac Employee Requirement
Thank you for choosing SG Fleet as your novated lease provider.
As part of the facilitation of the novated leasing program within Westpac, your employer requires you to
have a salary packaging account with Smart Salary to facilitate the delivery of your new vehicle.
Who is Smart Salary?
Smart Salary manages all salary packaging deductions on behalf of Westpac and will remit your salary
deductions to SG Fleet for your novated lease vehicle.
What do I need to do?
Already have a Smart Salary account?
Great, you’re all set and can proceed with finalising your vehicle delivery.
Still need to set up your Smart Salary account?
To set up your salary packaging account, simply follow these steps:
1. Contact Smart Salary at customersupport@smartsalary.com.au
2. Request a salary packaging application form: In your email, mention you are a Westpac
employee and require a Salary Packaging Application form for your SG Fleet Novated Lease.
3. Complete the application form and submit it with a copy of your latest payslip to Smart Salary.
Questions?
If you have any questions regarding the salary packaging application process, please contact Smart
Salary customer support at 1300 476 278.
If you have any questions or need more information regarding your SG Fleet Novated Lease, please call
us on 1300 138 235 or email novatedservices@sgfleet.com.
Thank you for choosing to package your vehicle with SG Fleet.
Kind regards
SG Fleet Team

name: Codes
description:
Write highly complex and well structured code for an application called NovAssistant. It is a tool that I want to use on a daily basis to increase my efficiency and organisation at work. This project is focused on the code itself. I want you to continue to develop this application and expand the code to increase the apps functionality and provide me with a tool that will increase my productivity and therefore increase my earnings. the main functions of the app are to: provide a quick initial "note pad" to fill in the customers information. This will allow me to avoid using the current CRM (microsoft Dynamics) initially as this is hard to use and isn't easy to fill in the data. I want a note pad section in a side panel, with areas for contact info, model and vehicle of interest details (make,model,colour etc), current employer, annual salary, pay cycle, length of term, kms per annum etc. THEN i want the main part of the app to be a multi-tool for assisting me, I want to be able to click through a phone script prompting process. Let me explain. On my opening screen I have a notes section on a side panel (this never goes away and is where I fill in the customer details that I need) the main screen is the existing dashboard, with a quick finance calculator tool tab, customer profiles tab etc i want an assistant button to be floating across all for quick access to open the NEW LEAD, (then select type of lead: Fresh Incoming Lead, Existing Incoming Lead, to be introduced and it would work like this, phone call comes in. *Click * the constantly present, floating "+", select either Fresh Incoming Lead or Fresh Outbound Lead
Fresh incoming lead, would open to show note pad section for filling details while you speak and then a series of AI generated prompts to assist with what i should say. I want buttons to then determine the next course of action. EG. press "Clueless" for someone whos calling with no prior knowledge of Novated leasing and thus pressing that would open the script for explaining novated leases, while being curated to also assist with my data collection in terms of asking for information at the right point such as salary which can sometimes be a little delicate. 
Depending on the responses to my questions, i want new scripts to appear based on the response choice i select. I want the note section where I fill the info to also prepopulate in the scripts and templates. For example if they tell me early on that they work for a company and i type that in, dont then prompt me to get company details, but also prepopulate scripts to include that such as, you mentioned you worked at XYZ, have you had a chance to speak with HR or seen SG Fleet listed on your employee benefits information? just to be sure we are the preferred supplier, if you don'tknow, no stress, i can check this end... " so on and so forth. we will build on this as we go.

name: NovAssistant 3
description:
# NovAssistant: Intelligent Productivity Transformation

## Project Vision
NovAssistant represents a paradigm shift in sales productivity, leveraging intelligent technology to reimagine how novated lease sales consultants interact with their digital ecosystem.

## The Challenge
Traditional sales tools fragment information, interrupt workflows, and fail to provide real-time, contextual guidance. Consultants waste countless hours navigating complex systems, losing critical sales momentum.

## Our Revolutionary Solution
By creating a seamless, intelligent overlay, NovAssistant transforms fragmented interactions into a unified, predictive sales experience. We don't just enhance productivity; we redefine the entire sales engagement model.

## Technological Innovation
- **Adaptive Intelligence**: Real-time context detection
- **Unified Communication**: Cross-platform interaction tracking
- **Predictive Assistance**: Intelligent next-step recommendations

## Impact Metrics
- 40-60% efficiency gain
- 25-30% faster response times
- Consistent, high-quality customer interactions

NovAssistant isn't just a tool—it's a strategic advantage in the competitive landscape of novated lease sales.
prompt_template:
# NovAssistant Project Knowledge Base & Development Guidelines

## Project Overview
NovAssistant is an intelligent browser extension designed to enhance productivity for novated lease sales consultants by providing contextual, real-time assistance across Microsoft ecosystem applications.

## Architectural Principles
### Core Architecture
- Browser Extension (Chrome/Edge)
- React-based frontend
- Modular component design
- Minimal performance overhead
- Cross-platform compatibility

## Code Consolidation Strategy
### Folder Structure Mandate
```
project/
├── public/
│   └── index.html
├── src/
│   ├── App.js
│   ├── index.js
│   ├── components/
│   │   ├── core/
│   │   ├── ai/
│   │   ├── ui/
│   │   └── utils/
│   ├── pages/
│   ├── services/
│   ├── styles/
│   └── utils/
```

## Development Guidelines
### Code Quality Criteria
1. Modular and reusable components
2. Consistent naming conventions
3. Performance-optimized implementations
4. Minimal external dependencies
5. Browser extension environment constraints
6. Secure data handling
7. Adaptive to different sales scenarios

## Technical Implementation Requirements
### Key Functional Modules
- Customer Journey Tracking
- Communication Monitoring
- Contextual Assistance Engine
- Notification Management
- Document Intelligence

## Coding Standards
### React Component Development
- Use functional components
- Leverage React Hooks
- Implement prop-type validation
- Create atomic, single-responsibility components
- Optimize rendering with React.memo and useMemo
- Implement error boundaries

### Performance Optimization
- Minimize re-renders
- Use lazy loading
- Implement efficient state management
- Reduce bundle size
- Optimize browser extension payload

## AI Integration Principles
- Context-aware assistance
- Dynamic script generation
- Predictive communication suggestions
- Machine learning readiness
- Adaptive recommendation system

## Code Consolidation Priorities
1. Remove duplicate code blocks
2. Standardize import/export patterns
3. Unify error handling
4. Implement consistent logging
5. Refactor complex logic into utility functions
6. Create centralized configuration management

## Extension-Specific Considerations
- Lightweight DOM manipulation
- Minimal browser resource consumption
- Secure communication channels
- Non-intrusive user interface
- Cross-browser compatibility

## Recommended Technologies
- React 18+
- TypeScript (preferred)
- Redux/Context for state management
- Webpack/Parcel for bundling
- Jest for testing
- ESLint for code quality
- Prettier for formatting

## Development Workflow
1. Modular component development
2. Comprehensive unit testing
3. Integration testing
4. Performance profiling
5. Continuous refactoring
6. User feedback integration

## Non-Negotiable Requirements
- MUST maintain sales consultant productivity
- MUST integrate seamlessly with Microsoft ecosystem
- MUST provide real-time, contextual assistance
- MUST be non-intrusive
- MUST handle multiple customer journeys simultaneously

## Future-Proofing Strategies
- Design for extensibility
- Create plugin/module architecture
- Implement feature flags
- Prepare for machine learning enhancements
- Build with scalability in mind

## Ethical AI Integration
- Transparent recommendation systems
- User privacy protection
- Bias mitigation in AI suggestions
- Clear opt-out mechanisms
- Explainable AI recommendations

## Technical Debt Management
- Regular code reviews
- Performance audits
- Continuous refactoring
- Dependency updates
- Documentation maintenance

## Final Objective
Transform novated lease sales processes through intelligent, adaptive technological augmentation while maintaining human-centric design principles.
```

name: NovAssistant 2.0
description:
# NovAssistant: Novated Lease Sales Productivity Enhancement
## Comprehensive Project Analysis & Implementation Strategy

### 1. Executive Summary

NovAssistant is a specialized productivity enhancement tool designed for novated lease sales consultants. Unlike traditional standalone applications that require extensive development and IT integration, NovAssistant works as an intelligent overlay to existing Microsoft systems. By augmenting rather than replacing current workflows, it creates a seamless experience that dramatically improves consultant efficiency, customer response times, and sales conversion rates.

The solution integrates across Microsoft Dynamics 365, Outlook, and other Microsoft products to provide real-time guidance, automated tracking, and proactive alerts—all delivered through the friendly and helpful "Nova" assistant persona.

### 2. Current State Analysis

#### 2.1 Business Process Understanding

The novated lease sales process follows a structured journey:
- **Initial Inquiry**: Customer expresses interest in novated leasing
- **Education & Qualification**: Consultant explains benefits and assesses suitability
- **Vehicle Selection**: Customer identifies preferred vehicle
- **Quotation**: Detailed lease terms and costs are presented
- **Application**: Documentation collection and submission
- **Approval & Settlement**: Financial approval and payment processing
- **Delivery**: Vehicle handover and customer onboarding

Each stage requires specific documentation, customer communications, and follow-up actions. Consultants typically manage 30-50 customers simultaneously at different journey stages.

#### 2.2 Current System Landscape

- **Microsoft Dynamics 365**: Primary CRM for contact management
- **Microsoft Outlook**: Email communication and calendar management
- **Microsoft Office Suite**: Document creation and management
- **Specialized quoting tools**: For generating novated lease quotes
- **Phone systems**: For customer calls (potentially integrated with Microsoft)

#### 2.3 Identified Pain Points

1. **Fragmented Information**: Customer data spread across multiple systems
2. **Manual Tracking**: No automated way to track customer journey progress
3. **Delayed Follow-ups**: Crucial response windows often missed
4. **Context Switching**: Constant toggling between applications disrupts productivity
5. **Knowledge Access**: Difficulty accessing right information during customer interactions
6. **Inconsistent Communication**: Variation in messaging quality between consultants

### 3. Solution Vision

NovAssistant creates a unified workspace that overlays existing systems while adding intelligent productivity features. The solution maintains the friendly "Nova" persona to provide guidance and alerts throughout the workday.

#### 3.1 Core Capabilities

1. **Unified Customer Timeline**
   - Aggregates all interactions (emails, calls, documents) in a single view
   - Automatically updates based on detected communications
   - Highlights key milestones and next actions

2. **Proactive Communication Monitoring**
   - Tracks all Outlook communications by matching email addresses to CRM contacts
   - Provides escalating alerts for unanswered messages (5min, 10min, etc.)
   - Prioritizes responses based on customer journey stage and urgency

3. **Contextual Sales Assistance**
   - Provides relevant scripts, objection handlers, and product information during calls
   - Suggests appropriate email templates based on customer journey stage
   - Offers real-time guidance during customer conversations

4. **Journey Tracking Visualization**
   - Shows exactly where each customer is in their sales journey
   - Predicts likely next steps based on communication patterns
   - Identifies stalled deals requiring intervention

5. **Document Intelligence**
   - Automatically categorizes attachments from emails
   - Tracks required vs. received documentation
   - Suggests missing documents needed for completion

#### 3.2 User Experience

The NovAssistant experience centers around a non-intrusive overlay that appears when contextually relevant:

1. **Sidebar Interface**: 
   - Docks to the side of Microsoft applications
   - Shows currently active customer and journey stage 
   - Provides quick access to relevant tools and information

2. **Nova Assistant Persona**:
   - Friendly notifications and reminders
   - Contextual suggestions delivered in a helpful, personalized tone
   - "Hi, I'm NovAssistant, but you can call me Nova. Let's get to work!"

3. **Smart Notifications**:
   - Appear based on detected activity and response times
   - Prioritized by urgency and customer stage
   - Actionable with one click

### 4. Technical Implementation Approach

The most effective implementation strategy combines Microsoft's built-in integration capabilities with custom interface elements:

#### 4.1 Core Architecture

1. **Browser Extension Component**:
   - Provides overlay UI and contextual assistance
   - Monitors web-based Outlook and Dynamics interfaces
   - Delivers notifications and alerts
   - Maintains the Nova assistant persona and interface

2. **Microsoft Power Automate Integration**:
   - Connects Outlook and Dynamics 365 data
   - Performs background synchronization
   - Processes email content for journey stage updates
   - Executes scheduled follow-up checks

3. **Local Storage Component**:
   - Maintains customer interaction timeline
   - Tracks response times and alerts
   - Persists user preferences and settings
   - Operates without requiring server infrastructure

#### 4.2 Data Flow Architecture

1. **Email Monitoring Pipeline**:
   - Detects new emails in Outlook
   - Matches sender to Dynamics contacts
   - Updates interaction timeline
   - Triggers alerts based on response time rules

2. **Customer Journey Tracking**:
   - Maps email and activity content to journey stages
   - Updates visualization of customer progress
   - Identifies required next actions
   - Alerts on stalled journeys

3. **Contextual Assistance Engine**:
   - Detects current activity context
   - Retrieves relevant scripts and templates
   - Provides real-time suggestions
   - Learns from user selections and feedback

### 5. Anticipated Benefits

1. **Efficiency Improvements**:
   - 40-60% reduction in time spent searching for information
   - 25-30% faster response times to customer inquiries
   - Elimination of missed follow-ups

2. **Sales Performance Enhancement**:
   - Higher conversion rates through consistent communication
   - Increased customer satisfaction from timely responses
   - Better handling of objections with contextual guidance

3. **Organizational Advantages**:
   - Minimal IT involvement required for implementation
   - No complex system integration projects
   - Leverages existing Microsoft investments

### 6. Implementation Roadmap

#### Phase 1: Core Framework & Email Monitoring
- Browser extension foundation
- Outlook integration for email monitoring
- Basic notification system
- Customer timeline prototype

#### Phase 2: Journey Tracking Enhancement
- Complete journey visualization
- Automatic journey stage detection
- Stalled deal identification
- Next action recommendations

#### Phase 3: Contextual Assistance
- Call script suggestions
- Email template integration
- Objection handling guidance
- Learning from user selections

#### Phase 4: Analytics & Optimization
- Performance dashboards
- Success pattern identification
- Personal productivity insights
- Continuous improvement suggestions

### 7. Next Steps

1. **Develop Technical Prototype**:
   - Create basic browser extension framework
   - Implement Outlook monitoring capability
   - Establish timeline visualization
   - Test performance and reliability

2. **User Experience Design**:
   - Refine Nova assistant persona
   - Design notification hierarchy
   - Create contextual assistance interface
   - Optimize for minimal disruption

3. **Integration Framework**:
   - Establish Microsoft Power Automate connections
   - Define data exchange patterns
   - Create synchronization logic
   - Test across Microsoft ecosystem

By pursuing this implementation approach, we can create a powerful yet lightweight assistant that truly enhances productivity without requiring complex IT projects or system replacements. The focus remains on making the consultant more effective through intelligent assistance rather than forcing adaptation to new systems.
prompt_template: Think with a very broad view/perspective on what we are trying to achieve. Suggest creative ideas to streamline my workflows and the way my systems integrate. Save me time where ever you can and simlify as much possible. I am trying to learn about the best ways that certain apps and systems work in syncronicity and harmony together. I no longer want to create my own, rather learn and integrate the existing apps i have available to me. Always consider the fact I have strict security restrictions in place so I am limited in what I can and cant install or download. Speak to me with a very step-by-step approach to breaking down complex computer/system processes i need to carry out, explain them in a very simple and use simple terminology, as if you were talking to someone who did not know how to operate computers very well and was not familiar with any computer terminology. my goal is to integrate Microsoft Dynamics, Outlook, Excel, Word, List, Notes and To Do. I will eventually learn more about AUtomate, power pages and power apps and grow this into the highly complex and far to difficult to understand web browser extension i was orginally aiming to create. however after considering the alternative option to not build an app as such, but become skilled at understanding how the apps i already have can be better utilitise is a much more effective way to go. Help me build a thorough understanding of the best ways to use these apps, what benefits they offer that i am likely unaware of, and once we decide what exactly we are going to do. then i want the break down in to very basic steps.

flowchart TD
    subgraph ExcelWorkbook["SG Fleet Script Navigator (Excel Workbook)"]
        subgraph MainSheet["Sheet 1: Script Navigator"]
            ScriptHeader["Header: SG Fleet Novated Lease Consultation
            Consultant Name | Date | Customer ID"]
            ScriptProgress["Progress Indicator: Initial Contact → Needs Analysis → Quote Preparation"]
            
            ScriptSection1["SECTION: INITIAL CONTACT
            Thank you for calling SG Fleet, this is [ConsultantName].
            [System displays customer info if existing customer]"]
            
            QuestionBlock1["QUESTION BLOCK: Vehicle Interest
            Do you have a specific vehicle in mind?"]
            
            DecisionPoint1{Yes/No buttons}
            
            PathYes["YES PATH (Vehicle Identified)
            • Make/Model fields appear
            • Vehicle type options display
            • Dealership questions follow"]
            
            PathNo["NO PATH (No Vehicle)
            • Script jumps to education section
            • General benefits explanation
            • Budget discussion"]
            
            ScriptContinuation["CONTINUATION PATHS:
            • Next questions based on answers
            • Data captured in background
            • Navigation controls always visible"]
        end
        
        subgraph DataSheet["Sheet 2: Data Repository (Hidden)"]
            CustomerData["Customer Information Table
            • Contact Details
            • Vehicle Preferences
            • Budget Parameters
            • Conversation History"]
            
            ExportFormat["Export-Ready Formats
            • Miles CRM Format
            • Outlook Task Format
            • Document Checklist"]
        end
        
        subgraph NavSheet["Sheet 3: Navigation Controls (Hidden)"]
            ScriptLogic["Script Logic Engine
            • Excel Formulas
            • IF/THEN Statements
            • Named Ranges
            • Conditional Formatting Rules"]
            
            NavSettings["Navigation Settings
            • Keyboard Shortcuts
            • Button Actions
            • Section Definitions
            • Visual Style Controls"]
        end
    end
    
    ScriptHeader --> ScriptProgress
    ScriptProgress --> ScriptSection1
    ScriptSection1 --> QuestionBlock1
    QuestionBlock1 --> DecisionPoint1
    DecisionPoint1 -->|Yes| PathYes
    DecisionPoint1 -->|No| PathNo
    PathYes --> ScriptContinuation
    PathNo --> ScriptContinuation
    
    ScriptSection1 -.-> CustomerData
    QuestionBlock1 -.-> CustomerData
    DecisionPoint1 -.-> ScriptLogic
    PathYes -.-> ScriptLogic
    PathNo -.-> ScriptLogic
    NavSettings -.-> ScriptContinuation
