# NOVATED LEASE PROCESS - COMPREHENSIVE CHECKLIST

## PHASE 1: INITIAL CONTACT

### Stage 1.1: Receiving and Qualifying the Lead

**Information to Record:**
- Customer's full name (as per driver's license)
- Contact number
- Email address
- Employer name (confirm they are eligible for novated leasing)
- Lead source (website, referral, etc.)

**Questions to Ask:**
- "Have you done a novated lease before?" (determines if basic explanation is needed)
- "Which employer are you with?" (verify employer is registered with SG Fleet)
- "What stage are you at in the car buying process?" (considering, decided on model, ordered, etc.)

**Actions Required:**
- Record lead in CRM/Miles
- Determine if first-timer or experienced with novated leasing
- Confirm recording the call for quality and training purposes
- Perform security check if existing customer (full name, DOB, address)

**Systems to Use:**
- Miles (CRM)
- Inbound call recording system

### Stage 1.2: Explanation for First-Time Customers

**Information to Provide:**
- Basic overview of novated leasing (refer to Initial Consult Call Script)
- Tax benefits explanation (income tax and GST savings)
- Running costs coverage (fuel, maintenance, insurance, registration, tires)
- End of lease options (residual payment explanation)
- Employer-specific benefits or arrangements (if applicable)

**Key Selling Points to Cover:**
- Convenience of bundled payments
- Pre-tax benefits on running costs
- GST savings on purchase price and running costs
- Budget certainty with fixed payments
- No need to pay large sum upfront

**Potential Objections to Address:**
- "It sounds complicated" - explain simplicity of process
- "What happens if I leave my employer?" - explain transferability
- "What if I want to sell early?" - explain early termination options
- "Is it better than just getting a loan?" - be ready with finance comparison

**Systems to Use:**
- Finance comparison tool (if customer is comparing to personal loan)

## PHASE 2: QUOTING PROCESS

### Stage 2.1: Gathering Vehicle and Customer Information

**Essential Vehicle Information:**
- Make, model, variant of vehicle
- New or used
- Dealer quoted price (if available)
- Accessories required
- Vehicle intended use (personal/work)
- Expected delivery date (critical for PHEV/EVs)

**Essential Customer Information:**
- Gross annual salary (excluding superannuation)
- Any additional allowances or income
- Payment cycle (weekly/fortnightly/monthly)
- Annual expected kilometers
- Fringe benefits currently sacrificed
- GST registration status (if self-employed)
- Driving history (for insurance purposes):
  * Any claims in last 3 years (how many)
  * Any DUI or negligent driving charges
  * Driver's license details

**Aftermarket Accessories Information (if interested):**
- Interest in window tinting
- Interest in paint/interior protection
- Interest in dash cam
- Interest in minor damage repair coverage
- Interest in EV charging equipment (if applicable)
- Interest in driver safety kit

**Documents to Request (if proceeding to quote):**
- Copy of driver's license
- Proof of income (payslip)
- Dealer quote (if available)

**Systems to Use:**
- Miles for quote generation
- QuoMo (if applicable)

### Stage 2.2: Creating and Sending the Quote

**Information Required for Quote Generation:**
- Template selection (T2P if available, otherwise New Docs)
- Vehicle procurement type selection
- Vehicle details (from previous stage)
- Duration of lease (1-5 years)
- Total expected distance
- Registration postcode
- Salary information
- Insurance/LeaseGuard requirements
- Accessories (dealer and aftermarket)

**Vehicle Tab Information:**
- Check list price in Miles vs dealer quote
- Enter discount in dealer discount field
- Match all onroads and dealer delivery
- For NSW - ensure CTP is quoted by system with CIC Allianz as provider
- Ensure "Dealer On Road" matches dealer price quoted

**Lease Services Tab Information:**
- Adjust services within DA allowance
- Add or remove services (LeaseGuard, roadside, own insurance)

**For Used Vehicle Quotes:**
- Change "Purchase Type" to used vehicle
- Set list price to 1/11 of asking price
- Enter build date, first registration date, registration expiry, current odometer
- For private sales, add Novated Customer as provider for on-road costs

**Documentation to Prepare:**
- Customized quote document
- Explanation of tax benefits (tailored to customer's salary)
- Finance comparison (if customer is comparing to loan)

**Systems to Use:**
- Miles
- Email template system
- Finance comparison tool (if needed)

## PHASE 3: APPLICATION PROCESS

### Stage 3.1: Standard Finance Application

**Required Customer Information:**
- Full name, date of birth, driver's license number
- Residential address (minimum 3 years history)
- Residential status (rent/own/board)
- Employment details (employer, time in job, previous if less than 3 years)
- Income details:
  * Base salary
  * Overtime/Allowances
  * Other income sources (rental, investments)
- Expense details:
  * Rent/Mortgage payments
  * Living expenses
  * Loan repayments
  * Credit card limits and balances
  * Other financial commitments

**Required Documentation:**
- Two recent payslips (within last 90 days)
- Clear copy of driver's license (front and back)
- Utility bill if address differs from license
- Bank statements (if conditioning is expected)
- Signed privacy consent form
- **Note:** Ensure TFN does not appear on any documents

**Application Process Checklist:**
- Verify full name matches license
- Check DOB matches license
- Check address matches license
- Check employer name on payslip matches application
- Check salary on payslip matches application
- Check for deductions needing clarification
- Confirm net salary exceeds expenses including proposed lease
- Ensure credit cards are declared (even with $0 balance)

**Systems to Use:**
- Online application portal
- Miles
- IMS
- Finance application manager

**Common Issues to Address:**
- Mismatch between declared expenses and actual
- Undisclosed credit cards or loans
- Recent employment changes
- Address discrepancies

### Stage 3.2: Refinance Application

**Additional Information Required:**
- Current financier details
- Contract/Account number with current financier
- Current vehicle details (registration, VIN)
- Residual value and due date
- Current lease term and payment amount

**Additional Documentation Needed:**
- Current payout letter/tax invoice from financier
- Current registration papers
- PPSR check

**Specific Process Requirements:**
- For Macquarie refinances: obtain tax invoice from Shannon/Andy
- Review residual value in Miles for accuracy
- Verify residual due date
- Plan for 2 weeks prior settlement date

**Systems to Use:**
- Miles
- IMS
- Finance application manager

### Stage 3.3: Finance Approval Process

**Standard Application Tracking:**
- Submit application via correct channel (CBA or Autonomy)
- Record application reference number
- Monitor application status (pending/conditionally approved/approved/declined)
- For conditional approvals, identify specific conditions required

**If Conditionally Approved - Common Conditions:**
- Certified ID copy requirement
- Income verification (additional payslips)
- Address verification (utility bills)
- Clarification of expenses
- Credit card evidence

**If Declined:**
- Identify reason for decline
- Consider alternative financier options:
  * If declined by CBA, try Autonomy
  * If declined by Autonomy, try CBA
- Review application for errors or missing information
- Consider lower vehicle price or shorter term

**Financier-Specific Requirements:**
- **CBA Requirements:**
  * Privacy consent form
  * Certified copy of driver's license
  * 2 payslips within 90 days
  
- **Autonomy Requirements:**
  * Cannot accept manual forms
  * Cannot edit customer data
  * Does not accept contracts of employment
  * Does not accept high kilometer residuals
  * Currently does not accept used vehicles

**Systems to Use:**
- Finance application manager
- IMS
- Financier portals

## PHASE 4: VEHICLE PROCUREMENT

### Stage 4.1: Dealer Procurement (New/Used)

**Information Required:**
- Dealer details (name, location, contact person)
- Full vehicle specification
- Agreed purchase price
- On-road costs breakdown
- Accessories included
- Expected delivery timeframe
- Dealer bank details (for payment)

**Documentation Needed:**
- Dealer quote/invoice
- Vehicle order form (if applicable)
- New car warranty information
- Pre-delivery inspection report (for used vehicles)

**Process Checklist:**
- Verify vehicle price matches quoted amount
- Confirm all accessories are included
- Validate all on-road costs
- Check delivery timeframe (critical for PHEV/EV FBT exemption)
- Request vehicle order confirmation

**Systems to Use:**
- Miles
- Dealer management system

### Stage 4.2: Private Sale

**Information Required:**
- Vendor's full name and contact details
- Vendor's bank account details (for payment)
- Vehicle details (make, model, year, VIN, registration)
- Agreed purchase price
- Current odometer reading
- Registration expiry date

**Documentation Needed from Vendor:**
- Registration papers
- PPSR clearance
- Copy of original tax invoice & proof of payment OR Statutory Declaration
- Statement by Supplier (signed by vendor)
- Vendor's DOB (for CBA Suitable Supplier Check)
- Inspection report (if purchase price over $60k)
- Valid payout letter (if vehicle is financed)
- Invoice signed by vendor

**Documentation Needed from Driver:**
- Bank details for on-road costs (if applicable)
- Current odometer reading confirmation

**Process Checklist:**
- Confirm vehicle is not recorded as stolen or written off
- Verify encumbrance matches payout (if financed)
- Ensure payout figure is equal or lower than purchase price
- Arrange bank account opening for disbursements (24-hour process)

**Systems to Use:**
- Miles
- PPSR check system
- Non-dealer sale checklist

### Stage 4.3: Sale & Leaseback

**Information Required:**
- Vehicle details (make, model, year, VIN, registration)
- Purchase price (market value)
- Current odometer reading
- Registration expiry date
- Driver's bank account details

**Documentation Needed:**
- Registration papers showing driver as owner
- PPSR clearance (showing no encumbrances)
- Copy of original tax invoice & proof of payment OR Statutory Declaration
- Statement by Supplier
- Inspection report (if purchase price over $60k)
- Invoice

**Process Checklist:**
- Confirm vehicle is not recorded as stolen or written off
- Verify no encumbrances exist on the vehicle
- Ensure registration documents show driver as owner/operator
- Arrange bank account opening for payment (24-hour process)

**Systems to Use:**
- Miles
- PPSR check system
- Non-dealer sale checklist

### Stage 4.4: Company Sale

**Information Required:**
- Company name and ABN
- Company contact person (must be authorized, e.g., Director or CEO)
- Company's GST registration status
- Vehicle details (make, model, year, VIN, registration)
- Agreed purchase price
- Current odometer reading
- Registration expiry date
- Company bank details

**Documentation Needed:**
- ABN lookup to verify GST status
- PPSR check
- Registration papers
- Inspection report (if purchase price over $60k)
- Documentation depending on GST status:
  * **If GST registered:**
    - Tax invoice (with GST) on company letterhead
    - Payout letter (if financed)
    - Original tax invoice & proof of payment (if not financed)
  * **If NOT GST registered:**
    - Invoice (no GST) on company letterhead
    - Statement by Supplier
    - Payout letter (if financed)
    - Original tax invoice & proof of payment (if not financed)

**Process Checklist:**
- Verify company ABN and GST status
- Check if vehicle is financed and obtain valid payout
- Ensure authorized person signs all documents
- For fixed and floating charge, obtain Notice of Release
- Arrange bank account opening for payment (24-hour process)

**Systems to Use:**
- ABN Lookup website
- Miles
- PPSR check system
- Non-dealer sale checklist

### Stage 4.5: PHEV/EV Special Process

**Critical Information Required:**
- Confirmed delivery date (must be before March 31, 2025 for FBT exemption)
- Vehicle qualification verification (must meet PHEV/EV criteria)
- Dealer confirmation of delivery timeline

**Documentation Needed:**
- Dealer confirmation of vehicle availability
- Written delivery confirmation with date
- PHEV/EV qualification documentation

**Special Process Requirements:**
- Flag lease as PHEV/EV in system
- Document expected delivery date
- Prioritize processing for faster settlement
- Customer acknowledgment of exemption requirements

**Important Notes:**
- Advise customer explicitly about March 31 deadline
- Ensure customer understands that after April 1, 2025:
  * Exemption only applies if keeping lease with same employer
  * No changes to novation agreement or driver allowed

**Systems to Use:**
- Miles with special PHEV/EV notation
- Priority settlement tracking

## PHASE 5: DOCUMENTATION & SETTLEMENT

### Stage 5.1: Standard Finance Documentation

**Documentation to Prepare:**
- Indicative Schedule (for signing and dating)
- Novation Agreement (for signing - not dating)
- Terms and Conditions (for customer to keep)
- Direct Debit Request (to complete, sign and date)
- Privacy Consent Form (for CBA only)

**Required Signing Instructions:**
- Signatures must be consistent throughout all documentation
- Wet signatures must match driver's license
- Full document packages required (no single signed pages)
- No photos of documents accepted
- Terms and Conditions not to be returned

**Distribution Method Options:**
- DocuSign with two-factor authentication
- Email attachments
- Physical mail (if necessary)

**Systems to Use:**
- DocuSign
- Email templates
- Miles

**Common Issues to Address:**
- Missing signatures
- Inconsistent signatures
- Incomplete forms
- Incorrect dates
- Undated forms that should be dated (or vice versa)

### Stage 5.2: Non-Dealer Sale Documentation

**For Vendor (additional to standard):**
- Tax Invoice (company sale with GST) OR Invoice (no GST)
- Original Proof of Purchase OR Statutory Declaration
- Vehicle Inspection Form (if required)
- PPSR verification

**For Driver (additional to standard):**
- Bank statement for on-road costs disbursement
- Current odometer reading confirmation

**Signing Requirements:**
- Vendor documentation must be signed by authorized person
- Statement by Supplier must be completed correctly
- Statutory Declaration must be witnessed appropriately

**Systems to Use:**
- Email templates for vendor and driver
- Miles
- Non-dealer checklist documentation

### Stage 5.3: Refinance Documentation

**Documentation to Prepare:**
- Indicative Schedule (for signing and dating)
- Novation Agreement (for signing - not dating)
- Terms and Conditions (for customer to keep)
- Direct Debit Request (to complete, sign and date)
- Privacy Consent Form (for CBA only)
- LeaseGuard acceptance form (if selected, sent separately)

**Additional Documentation Needed:**
- Current payout letter/invoice
- Registration papers
- PPSR check

**Important Timing Considerations:**
- Residual due date must be highlighted to customer
- Documentation completion must be finalized in advance
- Schedule submission for funding at least 3-4 days before payout expiry

**Systems to Use:**
- Refinance email templates
- Miles
- DocuSign

### Stage 5.4: Settlement Process

**Information Required:**
- Confirmed receipt of all required documentation
- Funding authorization timeframe (24-48 hours)
- Settlement activation process (24-48 hours)
- Payment processing timeframe
- Vehicle delivery coordination (if applicable)

**Documentation Needed:**
- Complete executed finance documents
- Any outstanding approval conditions met
- Payment details verified

**Process Checklist:**
- Verify all documents are correctly executed
- Submit for funding authorization
- Monitor approval status
- Communicate approval to customer
- Confirm payment processing
- Issue remittance advice to relevant parties
- Coordinate delivery timing with customer

**Systems to Use:**
- Miles
- Settlement process tracking
- Remittance generation system

### Stage 5.5: Vehicle Delivery & Post-Settlement

**Information Required:**
- Confirmed delivery date and time
- Delivery location
- Customer contact details for delivery
- Handover requirements

**Documentation to Provide to Customer:**
- Welcome package
- Fuel card information
- Online account access details
- Contact information for ongoing support
- Warranty information
- Service schedule
- User manuals for aftermarket products

**Post-Delivery Follow-up Checklist:**
- Confirm successful delivery
- Verify all accessories were installed
- Ensure fuel card is activated
- Verify online account access
- Schedule 30-day follow-up call
- Register for service reminders

**Systems to Use:**
- Miles
- Customer portal setup
- Fuel card activation system
- Welcome email template

## APPENDIX: SPECIAL SCENARIO CHECKLISTS

### Appendix A: High-Income Earners (Over $180,000)

**Special Considerations:**
- Higher FBT implications
- Greater tax benefits from novated leasing
- May qualify for premium offerings
- Higher ECM contribution requirements
- May be interested in luxury vehicles with LCT implications

**Additional Discussion Points:**
- Enhanced tax benefits at higher tax bracket
- Luxury Car Tax implications
- Premium insurance options
- High-end aftermarket accessories

### Appendix B: Unusual Employment Scenarios

**Contractor/Self-Employed:**
- GST registration status
- Business use percentage
- ABN verification
- Business structure (sole trader, company, etc.)
- Special documentation requirements

**Multiple Employers:**
- Primary employer identification
- Salary splitting arrangements
- Documentation from each employer
- Special novation agreement requirements

**Recent Employment Change:**
- Probation period considerations
- Additional income verification
- Previous employment history documentation
- Potential conditional approval requirements

### Appendix C: Interstate Vehicle Transfers

**Special Requirements:**
- Interstate registration transfer process
- Different stamp duty calculations
- CTP insurance considerations
- Roadworthy/inspection requirements
- Transit registration arrangements

**Additional Documentation:**
- Interstate registration forms
- Roadworthy certificates
- Vehicle inspection reports
- Transport arrangements

### Appendix D: Early Termination Scenarios

**Information to Collect:**
- Reason for early termination
- Timing of termination
- Vehicle condition
- Odometer reading
- Customer intentions (buyout, replacement, return)

**Documentation Required:**
- Early termination request form
- Current payout figure
- Vehicle condition report
- Market valuation
- Settlement options document

**Options to Present:**
- Payout and retain vehicle
- Replace with new novated lease
- Sell vehicle and settle payout
- Transfer lease to new employer

Services Guide

1 Financial Services Guide
This Financial Services Guide (FSG) contains
information about our services and charges,
your rights as a client as well as other things
you need to know relating to insurance matters
including how any complaints you may have will
be dealt with. We trust it will assist you in
deciding whether to use our services.
This FSG has been prepared and issued by SG
Fleet Australia Pty Limited (ABN 15 003 429
356, Authorised Representative Number
258510) (SG Fleet). SG Fleet is an authorised
representative of nlc Insurance Pty Ltd (ABN 64
104 847 252, Australian Financial Services
Licence Number 319038) of Level 2, Building 3,
20 Bridge Street, Pymble, NSW, 2073 (nlci) and
of Marsh Advantage Insurance Pty Ltd (ABN 31
081 358 303, Australian Financial Services
Licence Number 238369) of Level 19, One
International Towers, 100 Barangaroo Avenue,
Sydney, NSW, 2000 (Marsh).
This FSG is designed to assist you in deciding
whether to use the financial services offered by
SG Fleet when acting as a representative of
Marsh or nlci. This FSG provides you with
information about:
• the services we offer you;
• how we and our associates are paid;
• any potential conflict of interest we may
have; and
• our internal and external dispute resolution
procedures and how you can access them.
It is an important document. Please read it
carefully and keep it in a safe place.
If you are a retail client and we distribute an
insurance policy for you, or if we recommend
you buy a particular insurance policy, we will
give you a Product Disclosure Statement (PDS)
for the insurance product, unless you already
have an up to date version.
The PDS is prepared by each insurer and it is
designed to give you important information on
features, benefits and risks of the product to
assist you in making an informed decision about
whether to buy the product or not.
The PDS will be provided electronically at the
time of cover confirmation. Please check this
carefully when received or advise us
immediately should you not receive the
document. Should you have any queries you
should contact us immediately.
1. What services can we provide?
SG Fleet has been authorised by Marsh and
nlci to provide general financial product advice
about, and to deal in, general insurance
products by applying for, acquiring, varying and
disposing of those products on behalf of
another.
This means that when SG Fleet is providing you
with novated leasing packages, SG Fleet can
also help you by arranging insurance products
including:
• comprehensive motor vehicle insurance;
and
• LeaseGuard insurance.
SG Fleet can also provide factual information in
connection with the below insurance products if
previously acquired by you from nlci:
• Lease Protector insurance;
• extended warranty insurance;
• tyre & rim insurance; and
• scratch & dent insurance.
SG Fleet will also give you information and
usually provide a general recommendation or
opinion to you about those insurances but in
doing so, it will not be based on a consideration
of your personal needs or circumstances. You

A Guide to Our Relationship with You
and Others

2 Financial Services Guide
need to consider if the advice and the relevant
product is right for your circumstances as we
have not done this.
Not Independent
SG Fleet is an authorised representative of
Marsh and of nlci. SG Fleet is not
independent, impartial or unbiased because:
• we or our representatives or associates
may receive remuneration or other gifts
or benefit from:
− the distribution of the product you
buy
(e.g. commission that we retain);
− profit share arrangements with the
issuer of the product; or
− administrative service fees or for
some services we provide to the
issuer of the product,
• which may reasonably be expected to
influence the advice provided to you;
• we may be subject to direct or indirect
restrictions relating to the financial
products in respect of which advice is
provided; and
• we may have associations or
relationships with issuers of financial
products and others that might
reasonably be expected to influence the
advice provided to you.
2. Receiving documents electronically
It is standard practice for SG Fleet to
electronically distribute to you important
documents such as this FSG, a PDS for each
insurance product, and relevant insurance
certificates, as well as future policy renewal
notices.
Should you only wish to receive any of these
documents by normal mail, you should contact
us immediately and we will send such
documents to the last known address notified
or advised to us.
3. How do we manage conflicts of interest?
Conflicts of interest are circumstances where
some or all of your interests, are inconsistent
with or diverge from some or all of our interests.
We take any potential conflict seriously and
have a Conflicts of Interest policy with which we
comply. Our procedures and training are
designed to properly manage any conflict that
may arise. If you require any further explanation,
please ask us.
4. Who do we act for?
If we are given a “binding authority” from an
insurer, this means we can enter into insurance
policies and/or handle or settle claims on their
behalf without reference to them, provided it is
within the authority they have given us.
We have agreements with Marsh and nlci to
distribute insurance policies on their behalf and
not on your behalf.
Marsh issues the comprehensive motor vehicle
insurance and LeaseGuard policies, under a
binding authority, as an agent of the insurer.
This means that we act for and in the interest of
the insurer as our principal in providing services,
not yours.
nlci issued the Lease Protector insurance,
extended warranty insurance, tyre & rim
insurance, and scratch & dent insurance
policies, under a binding authority, as an agent
of the insurer. This means that we acted for
and in the interest of the insurer as our principal
in providing services, not yours.
5. Do we have any relationships or
associations with financial product issuers?
Vehicle Insurance Underwriters Pty Ltd (VIU)
operates as an underwriting agency under
binding agreements with various insurers.
Insurance products that involved VIU as the
underwriting agency are now in run-off and are
no longer offered.

3 Financial Services Guide
nlc Pty Ltd (nlc) owns VIU and nlc Insurance
Pty Ltd. SG Fleet and nlc are owned by SG
Fleet Management Pty Limited.
6. What information do we maintain about you
and how can you access it?
We maintain a record of your personal profile.
That record contains information about
insurance policies that we have distributed for
you. We also maintain records of any
recommendations made to you.
We are committed to implementing and
promoting a Privacy Policy, which sets out the
steps we take to maintain the privacy and
security of your personal information.
A copy of the Privacy Policy for SG Fleet is
located on our website
https://www.sgfleet.com/au/privacy-policy/. If
you would prefer to have a copy mailed to you
or wish to access your file, please contact us.
7. How can you give us instructions?
You need to give us instructions in writing by
letter, email or you can call us.
8. Automatic renewal – motor insurance
All policies with a renewal date will be
automatically renewed to ensure continuity of
cover. You can opt out of this process by
contacting us on 1300 001 087 or
insurance@sgfleet.com. Unless you (or your
employer if the vehicle insured is subject to a
salary packaging services agreement) have
directed us otherwise, you will receive an
invitation to renew and an opportunity to
respond if you do not require cover.
In all cases, the renewal invitation we will send
you will contain important information about
your ongoing disclosure obligations. These
disclosure obligations are serious and should be
strictly adhered to in order to ensure continued
indemnification under the relevant insurance
policy.
9. How are we remunerated for the services
provided?
SG Fleet may be paid in a number of ways that
vary according to the services you require and
the companies’ arrangements with the relevant
insurer. These are explained below:
SG Fleet is remunerated by commission from
the relevant insurer whenever you enter into a
comprehensive motor vehicle insurance policy
distributed by SG Fleet (including renewal and
some variations). The commission is a
percentage of the insurer’s base premium (i.e.
premium excluding stamp duty, fire services
levy, GST or any other government charges,
taxes, fees or levies).
For comprehensive motor insurance, the
current rate is 19% excluding GST.
Different insurers can agree to pay us different
commission rates for the same types of
products. The rates also vary for each product
type. In some cases, the rate may be higher
because of the role we play in performing
certain distribution functions the insurer would
otherwise have to perform. The commission
rate does not represent our profit margin as it
also reimburses us for administrative and other
expenses we incur in providing our services.
The commission is included in the premium
amount detailed on your invoice and SG Fleet
receives it when you pay the premium or at a
later time agreed with the insurer. By way of
example, if you buy a policy and the base
premium is $400 and our commission is 10%
excluding GST, we receive $40 plus GST on
this amount from the insurer.
For LeaseGuard, SG Fleet will charge you a fee
of 1.75% excluding GST, calculated as a
percentage of the applicable monthly finance
repayment (excluding GST).
SG Fleet may charge you:
Commission Paid to Us
Fees paid to us
Other Insurance Related Fees Paid by You

4 Financial Services Guide
• an administration fee of two hundred and
twenty dollars ($220) excluding GST in
addition to commission when you enter into
or alter a comprehensive insurance policy;
• a flat fee for distributing or altering an
insurance policy or a fee based upon the
time we spend advising you;
• any fees and government charges levied by
any insurer or product issuer;
• an annual management fee.
You will be informed of the nature and amount
of any fee involved prior to us performing the
service for you.
In some cases, another party may introduce you
to us. We may in return share a proportion of
our remuneration or pay them a referral fee.
Where applicable, we will provide you with
details of any remuneration or referral fee. If we
refer you to another service provider, we may
be remunerated by them for doing this. We will
inform you when this is the case.
Our staff receive an annual salary that may
include bonuses based on performance criteria
and achievement.
We may from time to time earn additional
remuneration from insurers with whom we have
profit share arrangements in place. If
applicable, this remuneration is based on claims
experience, not sales volume, and is set by the
relevant insurer. In order to manage any
potential conflict of interest that may arise in
connection with this remuneration, we have in
place, and comply with, documented conflicts of
interest policies and procedures.
From time to time we and our representatives
may also receive what are commonly referred
to as “soft dollar” benefits from product issuers
and other service providers we deal with. These
can include entertainment (e.g. meals, sporting
events and movies), conferences (e.g.
attendance at a product issuer conference or
sponsorship of conferences by product issuers
and other service providers), accommodation
and travel, business tools (e.g. software), gifts
(e.g. product issuer or service provider branded
promotional material and other occasional small
gifts such as bottles of wine or hampers on
special occasions).
These benefits are provided by a wide range of
product issuers and service providers. In most
cases they are incidental to or relate to our
development of an understanding of the
product issuer or service provider and their
product range and practices.
Ultimately, this can assist us in providing a
better service. If there is a refund of premium as
a result of a cancellation or adjustment to the
policy, we reserve the right to retain our
remuneration earned prior to the alteration. If
you require any further explanation, please ask
us.
10. Professional indemnity insurance
arrangements
We and our representatives and our authorised
representatives are covered under professional
indemnity insurance that complies with the
requirements of section 912B of the
Corporations Act 2001 (Cth). The insurance
(subject to its terms and conditions) will
continue to cover claims in relation to our
representatives, authorised representatives and
our employees who no longer work for us (but
who did at the time of the relevant conduct).
11. Cooling off period
A cooling off period may apply to an insurance
policy issued to you as a retail client. During the
period you may return the policy. Details of your
cooling off rights will be included in the relevant
PDS.
Referral Arrangements
Other Remuneration Information
“Soft Dollar” Benefits

5 Financial Services Guide
12. What should you do if you have a
complaint?
If you have any complaints about the service or
products we provide, we will work with you to
fix it. This may involve us working together with
the relevant Australian Financial Services
Licence holder in order to resolve the
complaint.
We always aim to resolve complaints as quickly
as reasonably possible, however, some
complaints may take longer to resolve due to
the complexity of the complaint. In resolving
your complaint, we will:
• acknowledge your complaint within one
business day of receipt and make sure we
have understood your complaint correctly;
• record your complaint and investigate your
complaint;
• provide you with a reference number, name
and contact details of our representative
assigned to handle your complaint;
• update you of our progress including the
expected timeframe of our response; and
• for complaints not resolved within 5
business days, provide a written response
explaining our findings, the reasons for
those findings and any action we have
taken or propose to take.
If at any time you feel our handling your
complaint or the response provided has not
satisfactorily resolved your complaint, we may
be able to offer you a review by our Customer
Advocate. SG Fleet has an appointed
Customer Advocate that maintains
independence of operational teams and can
investigate your concerns and provide a final
recommendation with which SG Fleet will
comply. You may also be able to refer your
complaint externally to the Australian Financial
Complaints Authority (AFCA). Please note there
is a time limit of 2 years following our written
response with our findings for you to lodge your
complaint with AFCA.
Email: complaints@sgfleet.com
Phone: 1300 138 235
Website:
https://www.sgfleet.com/au/policies/complaint
s-policy
In writing: You can write to us directly as
follows;
Attention: Customer Experience team
SG Fleet Australia Pty Limited Locked bag 1003
Gordon, NSW 2072 Australia
AFCA’s role is to assist consumers and small
business resolve disputes with financial service
providers including their broker or their
insurance company. AFCA is an independent
body and its service is free to consumers.
AFCA can be contacted on:
Call: 1800 931 678
Post: GPO Box 3, Melbourne, Victoria 3001
Website: www.afca.org.au
Email address: info@afca.org.au
Retain this document for your reference and
any future dealings with SG Fleet. If you have
any further questions about this FSG please
contact us on 1300 001 087 or
insurance@sgfleet.com.
To lodge a complaint with us, you can:
Lodging a complaint with AFCA:

SG Fleet Australia Pty Ltd
ABN 15 003 429 356
sgfleet.com | T: 1300 138 235

docs.filename: CBA Miles- Non Dealer Sale Checklistv4.pdf
docs.content:
NON-DEALER SALE CHECKLIST – CBA Miles
Document Classification: Confidential
Private Sale or Company Sale (not GST Registered) – Driver purchases a vehicle privately off of another individual – via
car sales, out of paper etc…
□ Registration Papers
□ PPSR
□ Inspection Report stamped by a mechanical workshop showing ABN (required if purchase price is over $60k)
□ Valid Payout Letter (if financed)
□ Invoice signed by Vendor
□ Copy of original tax invoice & proof of payment from Vendor (Receipts) OR Stat Dec signed by Vendor
□ Statement by Supplier signed by Vendor
□ Vendor Bank details if disbursement to the Vendor is required (in the form of a bank statement)
□ Driver Bank details if on roads are payable (in the form of a bank statement)
□ Vendor’s D.O.B for CBA to perform a Suitable Supplier Check (Vendor Wash)
□ Current Odometer Reading (captured at time of quote)
Sale & Leaseback – Driver owns the vehicle outright (no finance owing) and wishes to lease the vehicle back to themselves.
□ Registration Papers
□ PPSR (showing clear title)
□ Inspection Report stamped by a mechanical workshop showing ABN (required if purchase price is over $60k)
□ Copy of original tax invoice & proof of payment (Receipts) OR Stat Dec signed by the driver.
□ Invoice
□ Statement by Supplier
□ Driver Bank Details (in the form of a bank statement)
□ Current Odometer Reading (captured at time of quote)
Payout to another Financier – Driver has their vehicle financed through another financier and wishes to payout that
contract to lease back via sgfleet.
□ Registration Papers
□ PPSR
□ Valid Payout Letter
□ Statement by Supplier.
□ Invoice
□ Driver Bank Details (in the form of a bank statement, if disbursement is required)
□ Current Odometer Reading (captured at time of quote)
Company Sale (GST Registered) – Driver purchases a vehicle from a company/organisation.
Please note; all documentation to be signed by the Vendor, must be signed by someone authorised e.g. Director or CEO.
□ PPSR
□ Registration Papers
□ Inspection Report stamped by a mechanical workshop showing ABN (required if purchase price is over $60k)
□ Tax Invoice (if the company is registered for GST ensuring disbursements are outlined if vehicle is financed)
□ Vendor Bank Details (in the form of a bank statement if payment to the company is applicable)
□ Payout Letter (if financed)
□ Copy of original tax invoice & proof of payment (Receipts) OR Stat Dec signed by Vendor (If vehicle is NOT financed)
□ Driver Bank details if on roads are payable (in the form of a bank statement)
□ Current Odometer Reading (captured at time of quote)
□ Statement by Supplier.

When you get the file the first step is to check the rego. If the vehicle is registered in the company
name or the Payout is addressed to a company, this will be a company sale.
You will follow the standard checklist plus the additional steps.

• Bank statement for disbursement (if applicable)
• Valid Payout if applicable

If the seller is not the Director/Owner or CEO of the company, you can either ask him/her for
the contact details or liaise with the seller.

Invoice to be supplied as below. This can be completed, signed and returned by the authorised person
(i.e. Director of the company) alternatively Invoice can be drawn up on the company’s letter head in
the format below.

10
Private Sale with Finance Payout
Definition:
A private sale is negotiated between a buyer and a seller directly. In a private sale brokers and agents
are absent. The sale is made voluntarily between the individual parties.
Before you start, select the correct Non Dealer checklist to familiarise yourself with the additional
requirements and documents that has to be prepared for a Private Sale with a Payout.
The Checklist can be located here:
\\prod\dfs\Departments\Novated Sales\Sales Support Team\3. Training and Resources\Non Dealer
Sale
Example checklist with CBA as the financier

11
Please note the different documents required for a GST Payout and a Non GST Payout for
Ensure to select the correct one.
If it is a GST Payout the financier will issue a Tax Invoice and not a Payout letter
Eg: Lease Plan will issue a Tax Invocie and not a Payout letter
Step 1
PPSR Check
• Check the PPSR search to confirm the vehicle has not been recorded as Stolen or written
off and the encumbrance matches the Payout. If the vehicle has been recorded as Stolen or
Written off, please return to sales consultant
Step 2
Payout Letter or Tax Invoice
 The payout figure must be equal or lower than the Dealer Purchase Price.
If the Payout Letter/Tax Invoice is higher than the List Price Including GST (Sale Price) the
Vendor has to make a payment to pay the due amount “down” equal to or less than the agreed
amount and supply a new Payout Letter (Dealer Purchase Price) If the new payout figure is less than
the Dealer Purchase Price, the difference will be disburse to the Seller.
Step 3
On roads to Driver
Driver must supply a bank statement, this should be on file already and include:
o Logo and name of bank
o Drivers name and address
o BSB number
o Account number
Registration Papers
If there is a payout letter, registration papers are not required, unless it is an approval condition. The Payout
letter will include the Vehicle Identifiers – Vin and Engine Number as well as the registration number.
Disbursements:
A Bank Statement must be obtained from Driver and/or Vendor and send to Settlement to open the
Bank account as soon as you have the information. They can also use the singed Direct Debit form
from the driver. This takes 24 hours to open.
Private Sale with no Finance Payout
The same steps will apply with only the following exceptions:
• Registration documents will be required showing the Vin and Engine number and registered owner/
operator.
• PPSR must clear of any encumbrances as we will pay the full sell price to the Vendor

14
Sale & Leaseback
Definition of a Sale and Leaseback
Driver owns the vehicle outright (No finance owing) and wishes to lease the vehicle back to
themselves.
Before you start, select the correct Non Dealer checklist to familiarise yourself with the additional
requirements and documents that has to be prepared for a Sale and Leaseback
The check list can be located here:
\\prod\dfs\Departments\Novated Sales\Sales Support Team\3. Training and Resources\Non
Dealer Sale
Example checklist with CBA as the financier
Step 1
PPSR Check
• Check the PPSR on file to confirm the vehicle has not been recorded as Stolen or
written off and If the vehicle has been recorded as Stolen or Written off, please refer back
to sales consultant
• PPSR must clear of any encumbrances
Registration Papers
Registration documents are required showing the Driver as the owner/operator. A Registration
Renewal will not be suffice if it does not show the Vin and Engine number
Disbursements:
A Bank Statement must be obtained from Driver and/or Vendor and send to Settlement to open the
Bank account as soon as you have the information. They can also use the singed Direct Debit form
from the driver. This takes 24 hours to open.

17
If a vehicle is encumbered, the vendor is who the finance is under. Registration papers only show
operator. However in the instance of NO finance, the Vendor is who the vehicle is registered to.
EG: Payout letter is Joe Block and registration papers indicates Jane Citizen. Joe Block will be the
Vendor.

docs.filename: Script - Chasing Refinance Docs - Jan 24 V1.docx
docs.content:
Script -- Refinance Document Chasing

**Jan 2024**

The Script

Sales Support: *Good morning/afternoon, am I speaking with (Drivers'
Name).*

*Driver:* Yes

Sales Support: Hi (Driver name), this is (sales admin name) from
**sg**fleet. I am helping (Sales Consultants Name) and have issued out
your finance documents for execution to finalise your refinance. Is this
a convenient time to speak to you about the next steps?

Driver Yes

Sales Support: I do need to inform you the call is recorded for quality
and training purposes. Before I discuss any specifics for your lease, I
need to perform a security check, can you please confirm your full name,
date of birth and residential address.

Driver: Driver to confirm

Sales Support: Thank you.

eDOCS Your contracts have been sent to (email XXXXXXXX) and utilised 2
step authentication and DocuSign. Can you please confirm that is the
best email and you have access to this mobile to receive the code.

Driver: Yes

Email Docs (CBA/Autonomy)

I have sent you an email to (email XXXXXXXX), attached are your novated
lease contracts that you will be required to sign and return. Although
the instructions in the email are clear, please take note that called
out in the email is where we do or do not require documents to be dated.

> Some documents cannot be dated as the dates will align with your lease
> commencement date; this will be completed by our settlements team.
>
> If you are wet signing, please ensure your signature matches that of
> your driver's licence. When scanning and emailing back we cannot
> accept the single signed pages.

Sales Support: The documents may have been sent to your spam or junk
folder. Please check there as well if you don't receive them in the next
few hours.

> *I have also sent you an email noting any additional information or
> approval conditions from the financier* **(only if applicable)** -- at
> this stage you will know if they have any conditions -- read through
> the below regarding CID or move on to DA).
>
> ***\*If approval condition\****
>
> To satisfy the bank's approval condition, we require a certified copy
> of your Australian Driver's Licence. Please refer to the email for
> instructions on how to obtain a certified copy.
>
> We have your residential address as XXXXXXX. Is this the same as on
> the driver's licence?

Driver: Yes

> No (please request a utility bill/rates notice/rental agreement
> reflecting the same address as on the document)

**Delegated**

**Authority (DA) YES -** Once you have signed the documents, we will
have the Novation Agreement signed by sgfleet as we have Delegated
Authority.

> OR
>
> **NO -** Once you have signed the documents, we will have the Novation
> Agreement signed by your Employer. When this is returned to us, we
> will sign and finalise the documents.
>
> [(EXCEPTION NSW Police and Department of Defence)]{.mark}

Sales Support: Do you have any questions at this point?

Driver: No

VDC: Our contact details are at the bottom of the email. Should you have
any questions as you work through the documents, please do not hesitate
to contact the Sales Admin Team. Your residual due date is XX/XX if you
can ensure the contracts are returned 2 weeks prior where possible.

> Thank you for your time and I look forward in receiving your
> documents. Have a great day!
>
> End call.

docs.filename: Case Study - For Template of layout and formating
docs.content:
1.	FBT Group Exercise 

i.	Phil Walker from LaTrobe University is buying a new Ford Everest. The base price of the car is (excluding on-roads & accessories) is $57,000. He adds the following extras: Tinted Windows $495, Towbar $1,450, Floor Mats $185. The Dealer Delivery is $1,750 and all these expenses include GST. The Stamp Duty is $2,520, Rego is $536, and CTP is $450. He earns $150,000 per year. He travels around 22,000kms

•	What is the Drive Away Price of the vehicle?
Base Price of car	$57,000
+Tinted Windows 	$495
+Towbar 		$1,450		
+ Floor Mats 		$185
+ Dealer Delivery 	$1,750
Total $2,245
+ Stamp Duty 		$2,520
+ Rego 			$536
+ CTP			$450
Total 	$3,506
Total Drive Away Price	 $62,751

•	What is the FBT Cost Base of vehicle?
o	FBT Cost Base is the total value of the vehicle, plus accessories and inclusions, excluding state govt’ charges.
	$57,000 + $2,245 = $59,245

•	What would be the required Post Tax (ECM method) that SG Fleet would need to collect per year to eliminate the FBT liability?
o	20% of the FBT Cost Base Value per year. 
o	$59,245 x 0.2 = 	$11,849 per annum
 ~ or ~  $987.41 per month
 ~ or ~  $493.70 per fortnight

Finance Payments $1,200 p/m
Running costs $820 p/m
He travels around 22,000kms

•	What are the annual total package costs for this novated lease?
Finance Payments 	  $1,200 p/m
Running costs 		+$820 p/m
Total Package cost 	  $2,020 p/m
Annual Package cost	  $24,240 Per Annum

•	Using the ECM method, what would be the split between pre-tax and post-tax deductions (annual & fortnightly)?

Annual Total package cost	= $24,240 p/a / $2020 p/m
less
Post Tax Contribution 		= $11,849 p/a / $987.41 p/m
Pre-Tax Contribution		= $12,391p/a / $1,032.58 p/m

docs.filename: AI-Powered Email Template System for Novated Lease Consultants.md
docs.content:
# AI-Powered Email Template System for Novated Lease Consultants

## AI-Driven Email Strategy

This system provides structured prompts for generating highly effective, personalized customer communications throughout the novated lease sales process. Each template includes specific variables to customize and guidance on when to use each template type.

## Initial Contact Templates

### First-Time Novated Lease Inquiry

**When to use:** For leads who have expressed interest but have limited understanding of novated leasing.

```
Please create a personalized introduction email for [Customer Name] who works at [Employer] and has inquired about a novated lease for the first time. They are interested in a [Vehicle]. Include:

1. A warm introduction and confirmation of their inquiry
2. A brief, clear explanation of novated leasing (3-4 sentences maximum)
3. The top 3 benefits most relevant to their employer type
4. A clear call to action to schedule an initial consultation call
5. My contact information
```

### Specific Vehicle Inquiry

**When to use:** For leads with a specific vehicle in mind who need pricing information.

```
Please create a personalized response for [Customer Name] who has inquired about leasing a [Vehicle] through a novated arrangement. They work at [Employer] and earn approximately [Salary Range]. Include:

1. Acknowledgment of their specific vehicle interest
2. 2-3 sentences about the suitability of this vehicle for novated leasing
3. A question about their preferred lease term and annual kilometers
4. A clear next step to gather remaining information for a quote
5. My contact information
```

### PHEV/EV Specific Inquiry

**When to use:** For customers interested in a PHEV or EV, especially with the March 31, 2025 deadline approaching.

```
Please create a personalized response for [Customer Name] who has inquired about a PHEV/EV [Vehicle] through novated leasing. They work at [Employer]. Include:

1. Acknowledgment of their interest in this eco-friendly vehicle
2. Important information about the March 31, 2025 FBT exemption deadline
3. A brief explanation of the significant tax advantages available before this date
4. A sense of urgency regarding vehicle ordering timeframes
5. A clear call to action to proceed quickly to ensure eligibility
6. My contact information
```

## Quote Follow-Up Templates

### Initial Quote Presentation

**When to use:** When sending a freshly prepared quote to a customer.

```
Please create a personalized email for [Customer Name] to accompany their novated lease quote for a [Vehicle]. Their quote details include:
- Monthly payment: $[Amount]
- Lease term: [Years]
- Estimated annual tax saving: $[Amount]
- Residual value: $[Amount]

Include:
1. A friendly opening referencing our previous conversation
2. A brief explanation of the key financial benefits in their specific quote
3. Clear explanation of the next steps to proceed
4. Any time-sensitive information (quote validity, vehicle availability)
5. An offer to discuss any questions
6. My contact information
```

### Quote Follow-Up (No Response)

**When to use:** 3-5 days after sending a quote with no customer response.

```
Please create a follow-up email for [Customer Name] who received a novated lease quote for a [Vehicle] on [Date] but hasn't responded. Include:

1. A friendly check-in reference to the quote
2. A reminder of 1-2 key benefits specific to their situation
3. An acknowledgment that they may still be considering or have questions
4. A specific question to re-engage them (e.g., "Is there any specific aspect of the quote you'd like me to explain further?")
5. A gentle reminder of any time-sensitive elements
6. My contact information
```

### Objection Handling - Price Concerns

**When to use:** When a customer responds with concerns about the cost.

```
Please create a response for [Customer Name] who has expressed concerns about the monthly cost ($[Amount]) of their [Vehicle] novated lease quote. They specifically mentioned [Specific Concern]. Include:

1. Acknowledgment of their concern about cost
2. A clear breakdown comparing the novated lease cost vs. traditional financing
3. Emphasis on the tax advantages and bundled services
4. An offer to adjust terms (if possible) to better meet their budget
5. A suggestion for a brief call to discuss alternatives
6. My contact information
```

### Objection Handling - "Need to Think About It"

**When to use:** When a customer is hesitant and wants more time.

```
Please create a response for [Customer Name] who has said they need time to think about their [Vehicle] novated lease quote. Include:

1. Understanding and support for their need to carefully consider
2. Additional information that might help their decision process
3. Clarification of any potential timeline considerations (quote validity, price changes)
4. A value comparison showing long-term benefits
5. A non-pressuring offer to answer any specific questions
6. My contact information
```

## Documentation Process Templates

### Finance Application Instructions

**When to use:** When sending finance application forms to a customer.

```
Please create detailed instructions for [Customer Name] regarding their finance application for a [Vehicle] novated lease. Include:

1. A clear list of required documents (driver's license, payslips, etc.)
2. Specific guidance on completing the application correctly
3. Information about the approval timeline and process
4. Any employer-specific requirements
5. Next steps after submission
6. My contact information
```

### Missing Documentation Follow-Up

**When to use:** When following up on incomplete documentation.

```
Please create a follow-up email for [Customer Name] regarding their incomplete finance application for a [Vehicle]. They are missing [Specific Documents]. Include:

1. A friendly reminder about the missing documentation
2. Clear instructions for providing the required items
3. The impact of these documents on their application timeline
4. An offer to assist if they're having difficulty
5. A timeline for expected completion
6. My contact information
```

### Private Sale Documentation Guide

**When to use:** For customers pursuing a private sale novated lease.

```
Please create a comprehensive guide for [Customer Name] who is pursuing a private sale novated lease for a [Vehicle] priced at $[Amount]. Include:

1. A complete checklist of required documentation
2. Clear explanation of documentation needed from the seller
3. Explanation of the inspection requirements
4. Timeline expectations for the private sale process
5. Next steps after documentation collection
6. My contact information
```

## Aftermarket Product Templates

### Insurance Recommendation

**When to use:** When recommending comprehensive insurance.

```
Please create a personalized email for [Customer Name] recommending comprehensive insurance for their [Vehicle] valued at $[Amount]. Include:

1. The specific benefits of our insurance vs. standard policies
2. Emphasis on the gap protection for lease payout
3. A clear cost comparison showing the tax-effective price
4. The ease of inclusion in their salary packaging
5. A simple acceptance process
6. My contact information
```

### Premium Protection Package

**When to use:** When offering the complete vehicle protection package.

```
Please create a persuasive email for [Customer Name] recommending our Premium Protection Package for their new [Vehicle]. Include:

1. Congratulations on their new vehicle selection
2. The components of the protection package (exterior/interior protection, tint, etc.)
3. The specific benefits for their vehicle type
4. The convenience of bundling with their lease
5. The limited-time Driver Safety Kit offer
6. A simple acceptance process
7. My contact information
```

## Settlement and Delivery Templates

### Approval Confirmation

**When to use:** When notifying a customer of finance approval.

```
Please create an exciting approval notification for [Customer Name] whose finance for a [Vehicle] has been approved. Include:

1. Congratulations on their approval
2. Clear next steps in the settlement process
3. Timeline for expected documentation and delivery
4. Any actions required from them at this stage
5. Expression of appreciation for their business
6. My contact information
```

### Delivery Coordination

**When to use:** When coordinating vehicle delivery details.

```
Please create a delivery coordination email for [Customer Name] whose [Vehicle] is ready for delivery on [Date]. Include:

1. Confirmation of delivery details (date, time, location)
2. Any identification or documentation they should bring
3. Information about the delivery inspection process
4. Initial vehicle operation guidance
5. Post-delivery support information
6. My contact information
```

## Post-Settlement Templates

### Welcome and Onboarding

**When to use:** After vehicle delivery to welcome the customer.

```
Please create a welcome email for [Customer Name] who has just taken delivery of their [Vehicle]. Include:

1. Congratulations and welcome to SG Fleet
2. Overview of their online account access
3. Key contacts for different service needs
4. Brief explanation of how to use fuel cards, maintenance services
5. Information about their first payment date
6. My contact information and invitation for any questions
```

### Satisfaction Check-In

**When to use:** 2-4 weeks after delivery to check on satisfaction.

```
Please create a check-in email for [Customer Name] who took delivery of their [Vehicle] on [Date]. Include:

1. A friendly inquiry about their experience with the vehicle
2. Confirmation that their salary packaging is operating correctly
3. Reminder of how to access services (fuel, maintenance)
4. Request for feedback on the overall process
5. Invitation to refer colleagues (if appropriate)
6. My contact information
```

# Personalized Email Template Database

## 1. Objection Handling Templates

### Price Objection Email

```
Subject: Understanding the Value in Your [Vehicle] Novated Lease Quote

Hi [First Name],

Thank you for your feedback regarding the quote for your [Vehicle] novated lease. I understand your concerns about the monthly payment being higher than expected.

When comparing a novated lease to other finance options, it's important to remember that our quote includes:

1. **Complete running costs package** - fuel, insurance, servicing, registration, tires and maintenance are all covered in your single payment
2. **Significant tax advantages** - with most running costs paid from pre-tax salary
3. **GST savings** on both the vehicle purchase (~$[Amount]) and ongoing expenses
4. **Budgeting simplicity** - no surprise expenses throughout the lease term

For a direct comparison, here's how your novated lease compares to traditional financing:

**Novated Lease:**
- Monthly payment: $[Amount]
- Estimated annual tax savings: $[Amount]
- Total net annual cost after tax benefits: $[Amount]

**Traditional Car Loan:**
- Monthly loan repayment: $[Amount]
- Additional monthly running costs: ~$[Amount]
- No tax benefits
- Total annual cost: $[Amount]

This represents a potential annual saving of approximately $[Amount] through the novated arrangement.

I'd be happy to schedule a call to walk through these figures in detail, or I can prepare an alternative quote with different options if you'd prefer.

Kind regards,

Harrington Skeels
Novated Lease Consultant
+61 2 9494 1178
hskeels@sgfleet.com
```

I appreciate you taking time to consider the novated lease option for your [Vehicle]. Making the right decision for your new vehicle is important, and I want to ensure you have all the information you need.

Based on our conversation, I've prepared some additional details that might help with your decision:

1. **Flexibility Options:** Should your circumstances change, our leases offer options including:
   - Early termination possibilities

   - Extension options at the end of term

2. **Tax Efficiency Breakdown:** Your specific tax savings would be approximately:
   - Income tax savings on running costs: ~$[Amount]/year
   - GST savings on purchase: $[Amount]
   - GST savings on running costs: ~$[Amount]/year

3. **Timeline Considerations:**
   - Current manufacturer wait time: [Time period]
   - Current quote validity: [Date]
   - Potential price changes after this date: [Details if known]

I've also attached a personalized comparison showing how your lease stacks up against other financing methods based on your specific situation.

If you have any specific concerns or questions, I'm here to help. Would it be useful to schedule a brief call to discuss any particular aspects of the lease?

Kind regards,

Harrington Skeels
Novated Lease Consultant
+61 2 9494 1178
hskeels@sgfleet.com
```

- What happens at the end of the lease term?

**3. Key Dates and Commitments:**

If you and your partner would like to arrange a joint call to discuss any aspects of the lease, I'd be more than happy to schedule that at a convenient time.

Kind regards,

Harrington Skeels
Novated Lease Consultant
+61 2 9494 1178
hskeels@sgfleet.com
```

### "Researching Other Options" Email

Hi [First Name],

Thanks for letting me know you're exploring different options for your [Vehicle]. That's a smart approach, and I'd like to help provide some clarity on how our novated lease offering compares to alternatives.

I've prepared a detailed comparison based on your specific circumstances:

**Novated Lease vs. Dealer Finance:**

**Key Differentiators of SG Fleet's Offering:**

- [Unique benefit 3]

If you've received other quotes or offers you'd like me to analyze, I'd be happy to provide an objective comparison based on your total ownership costs. This would include all factors like residual values, tax implications, and included services.

Harrington Skeels

+61 2 9494 1178

## 2. Client-Specific Situation Templates

Subject: Important FBT Exemption Information for Your PHEV [Vehicle] Lease

Hi [First Name],

Following our discussion about your interest in the PHEV [Vehicle] through a novated lease, I wanted to provide you with important information regarding the FBT exemption.

**Critical Deadline:**
To qualify for the FBT exemption, your PHEV must be delivered on or before March 31, 2025. After this date, the exemption will no longer be available for new PHEV novated leases.

**What This Means for You:**
- Current delivery estimate for your selected vehicle: [Timeframe]
- Last recommended order date to meet deadline: [Date]
- Potential tax benefit of securing the exemption: Approximately $[Amount]/year

**Exemption Protection:**
If your PHEV is delivered before March 31, 2025:
- The exemption will continue for the duration of your lease
- You must maintain the lease with your current employer
- No changes can be made to the existing novation agreement or driver

**Your Options:**
1. **Proceed now** to maximize chances of meeting the deadline
2. **Consider fully electric** alternatives (which will maintain exemption beyond March 31)
3. **Select a conventional vehicle** if the deadline cannot be met

Given current supply timelines, I recommend making a decision by [Date] to ensure the best chance of qualifying for the exemption.

Please let me know if you'd like to discuss this further or if you have any questions about the implications for your lease.

Kind regards,

Harrington Skeels
Novated Lease Consultant
+61 2 9494 1178
hskeels@sgfleet.com
```

### First-Time Novated Lease Email

```
Subject: Your First Novated Lease - Everything You Need to Know

Hi [First Name],

Thank you for your interest in a novated lease for the [Vehicle]. Since this is your first novated lease, I wanted to provide some additional information to help you understand the process and benefits.

**What is a Novated Lease?**
A novated lease is a three-way agreement between you, your employer, and SG Fleet. Your employer agrees to make lease payments on your behalf through salary deductions, offering significant tax advantages.

**The Key Benefits:**
1. **Tax Savings:** Running costs come from your pre-tax salary, reducing your taxable income
2. **GST Savings:** You don't pay GST on the vehicle purchase or running costs
3. **Budgeting Simplicity:** One regular payment covers all vehicle expenses
4. **Reduced Admin:** We handle registration, insurance, and maintenance scheduling

**How Your Package Works:**
Your quote includes:
- Vehicle lease payments
- Comprehensive insurance
- Registration and CTP
- Scheduled servicing
- Tires and maintenance
- Fuel costs
- Roadside assistance

**Simple Process Overview:**
1. Approval (1-5 business days)
2. Vehicle ordering (if not already available)
3. Document signing
4. Delivery
5. Ongoing management through our online portal

**Your Specific Package:**
Based on your situation:
- Estimated monthly payment: $[Amount]
- Approximate annual tax saving: $[Amount]
- Lease term: [Years]
- Residual value: $[Amount]

I've attached a "Novated Leasing 101" guide that explains everything in more detail. I also recommend watching our short explainer video here: [Video Link]

I'm happy to schedule a call to walk through any questions you might have about this new concept. Would you prefer a morning or afternoon discussion?

Kind regards,

Harrington Skeels
Novated Lease Consultant
+61 2 9494 1178
hskeels@sgfleet.com
```

- Invoice signed by the vendor
- Original tax invoice & proof of payment OR Statutory Declaration
- Statement by Supplier signed by vendor
- Vendor bank details (bank statement)
- Your bank details (bank statement)
- Current odometer reading

**Process Timeline:**
1. Document collection (typically 3-7 days)
2. Finance application and approval (1-5 business days)
3. Settlement preparation (3-5 business days)
4. Payment processing (1-2 business days)

**Important Considerations:**
- Vendor requirements: We'll need to contact the seller to obtain certain documents
- Settlement timing: If the vehicle is currently financed, we'll need to align with the payout letter expiry
- Vehicle inspection: Depending on the value and financier requirements

**Next Steps:**
1. Complete the attached private sale information form
2. Provide your driver's license and two recent payslips
3. Ask the vendor to prepare their required documentation

I've attached our private sale guide and template documents to help both you and the vendor prepare everything needed.

Harrington Skeels

- [Any actions required from customer, if applicable]
- [Any industry news affecting deliveries, if relevant]

I will continue to monitor your order and provide weekly updates. If you have any questions or concerns about the timeline, please don't hesitate to contact me.

Once your vehicle reaches the next major milestone, I'll be in touch with more details about the upcoming steps.

Kind regards,

Harrington Skeels
Novated Lease Consultant
+61 2 9494 1178
hskeels@sgfleet.com
```

### Finance Status Update Email

```
Subject: Status Update - Your [Vehicle] Novated Lease Application

Hi [First Name],

I wanted to provide you with an update on the status of your novated lease application for the [Vehicle].

**Current Application Status:**
- [✓] Application submitted
- [✓] Employer verification
- [⟳] Financier assessment
- [ ] Final approval
- [ ] Document preparation
- [ ] Settlement
- [ ] Vehicle procurement/payment

**Details on Current Stage:**
Your application is currently with [Financier] for assessment. They have confirmed receipt and have indicated the following:
- Expected decision timeframe: [Timeframe]
- Any additional information

docs.filename: AI-Powered Daily Task Manager for Novated Lease Consultants.txt
docs.content:
# AI-Powered Daily Task Manager for Novated Lease Consultants

## Morning Routine (8:00-8:30 AM)

**AI Prompt for Morning Planning:**
```
Based on my CRM data, please generate:
1. A prioritized list of the top 10 clients needing follow-up today, sorted by:
   - Quotes awaiting decision (7+ days old)
   - Finance applications awaiting documentation (3+ days)
   - Approved deals awaiting settlement
   - New leads requiring initial contact
2. Flag any PHEV orders that need urgent attention due to March 31 deadline
3. Identify any lease quotes expiring within 7 days
4. Summarize my sales progress toward monthly targets
```

**Execute Morning Email Review:**
- Clear inbox from overnight
- Flag and categorize new inquiries
- Schedule callbacks for new leads

**Prepare Daily Focus List:**
1. Priority follow-ups (identified by AI)
2. Documentation collection tasks
3. Quote preparation requirements
4. Settlement processing needs

## Mid-Morning Productivity Block (9:00-11:00 AM)

**Focus on Outbound Communication:**
- Call new inquiries from overnight
- Follow up on 50% of pipeline by phone
- Document all conversation notes in CRM
- Send follow-up emails for any missed calls

**For Each Call, Complete:**
- Update CRM with current status
- Document any objections or concerns
- Schedule next follow-up date
- Request commitment (finance app or signed VSSS)

## Mid-Day Processing Block (11:00-3:00 PM)

**AI Prompt for Documentation Processing:**
```
Please review my pending documentation list and:
1. Generate customer-specific follow-up emails for missing documents
2. Create a checklist for each deal showing completion status
3. Flag any deals that are falling behind timeline expectations
4. Identify any potential compliance issues in submitted documentation
```

**Execute Documentation Processing:**
- Process customer requests
- Send finance applications from morning calls
- Process incoming deals
- Complete all admin and VDC requests

## Afternoon Follow-Up Block (3:00-4:00 PM)

**Contact Strategy:**
- Call any new inquiries
- Follow up on morning quotes
- Address questions on sent quotes
- Request commitment on each call

**AI Prompt for Objection Handling:**
```
Based on the following customer objections from today's calls:
[List objections]

Please generate:
1. Personalized talking points to address each objection
2. Value-based comparisons showing novated lease benefits
3. Next-step suggestions for each scenario to move the sale forward
```

## End-of-Day Wrap-Up (4:00-5:00 PM)

**AI Prompt for Performance Review:**
```
Based on today's activities, please:
1. Summarize key accomplishments and progress
2. Identify any tasks that weren't completed
3. Generate a prioritized list for tomorrow
4. Suggest optimization opportunities based on today's challenges
5. Calculate my current performance against targets
```

**Complete Administrative Tasks:**
- Process finance applications from afternoon calls
- Update all CRM records
- Schedule tomorrow's priorities
- Send any outstanding emails

## Weekly Planning (Friday Afternoon)

**AI Prompt for Weekly Review:**
```
Based on this week's performance data, please:
1. Analyze conversion rates at each stage of the sales process
2. Identify bottlenecks or areas for improvement
3. Compare aftermarket product attachment rates to targets
4. Calculate progress toward monthly goals
5. Generate recommendations for next week's focus areas
```

**Prepare for Next Week:**
- Review pipeline and prioritize early week activities
- Identify customers needing additional attention
- Plan follow-up strategy for aged leads
- Schedule important meetings and calls

**[Miles call script template]{.underline}**

**Controlling introduction**

-   Hello is that \**name*\*?

-   Hi \**name*\*, its \**consultant*\* from the leasing team, how are
    you?

-   Good thanks, I understand you work for \**Employer*\* and you are
    looking into a Novated Lease?

-   Perfect, now have you done one before or do you know much about
    them?\
    *\*If they say yes, please ask them if they want anything clarified
    or even a quick overview of Novated Leasing\**

-   Okay no problem, I can give you a quick overview of Novated Leasing,
    then I can ask a few questions and get you a quote out, is that
    okay?

-   I do also have to let you know the call is recorded, is that okay?

**Phase 1 -- Value, Procurement, General overview**

-   Novated Leasing is one of the most affordable ways to get a new car

-   It starts with you selecting a vehicle, which we can source for you
    from our large dealer network with access to fleet discounts.

-   Using this vehicle and some other information such as salary and
    kilometres, we draw up a package which is deducted straight from
    your pay.

-   The package includes not just the finance, but all the running costs
    including; petrol, maintenance, insurance, registration and tyres

**Phase 2 -- Running costs, Convenience, Account**

-   These all accrue up in your account and wait for you to need to
    spend the funds

-   As an example, when you need petrol every week, insurance every
    month, or servicing every year, there will be money in your account
    ready for these

-   When you need to use these funds, they can be accessed automatically
    from the account. When you need fuel, swipe your fuel card, we can
    pay registration direct, as well as your mechanic or tyre providers
    when the vehicle is serviced

-   You can also pay for items yourself and seek reimbursement in your
    online account

-   Anything surplus funds you have not used are automatically returned
    at the end of lease

**Phase 3 -- Tax savings, residual**

-   When the funds are deducted from pay, there is a split of pre-tax
    and post-tax

-   The post-tax deduction fully offsets FBT -- so none payable.

-   Post-tax generally fits in finance, running costs generally in
    pre-tax

-   This means no income tax on petrol, maintenance, insurance,
    registration and tyres

-   On top of this you will also not pay gst on these, saving another
    10%

-   You also do not pay gst on finance, further saving on the vehicle

-   Lastly there is a residual value at the end of the lease, determined
    by the ATO which will be itemised on your quote

-   We will touch base six months out to run you through your three
    options, including buying it out, extending or replacing it.

-   In a nut shell, that is novated leasing. Any questions?

-   Okay no problems, I will now ask you a few questions to draw you up
    a quote.

**Vehicle questions**

  --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Term:            Annual                  Salary /       
                   Kms:                    Pay-cycle:     
  ------- -------- ---------- ------------ -------------- ------------------

  --------------------------------------------------------------------------

  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  Make/Model/Variant   Used:
  -------------------- ------------------------------------------------------
  Colour:              

  Accessories/Notes:   

  TRADE ADVANTAGE      
  ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Insurance Disclosure:

1.  2 or more insurance claims in the last 3 years:

2.  DUI or Negligent Driving charges in the last 3 years:

  -----------------------------------------------------------------------
  **Item**                    **Description**
  --------------------------- -------------------------------------------
  **Hydro Exterior            **o Easier to Clean\
  Protection**                o Harder to Scratch\
                              o High performance ceramic formula\
                              o Extreme durability & hardness\
                              o Certified to meet Boeing D6-17487
                              specifications**

  **Activ Interior            **o Can be applied to all fabric, carpet,
  Protection**                vinyl and leather surfaces\
                              o Protection against spills and stains and
                              UV damage\
                              o Maintain new car look and smell for
                              longer\
                              o Lifetime Warranty**

  **Driver Safety Kit**       **o First Aid Kit\
                              o Power bank and charger (For car and phone
                              batteries)\
                              o Fire Extinguisher\
                              o Roadside Electronic Flare Kit\
                              o + More**

  **Darkest Legal Window      **o Privacy\
  Tint**                      o Aesthetics\
                              o UV Protection\
                              o Lifetime Warranty**

  **Minor Damage Repair**     **o Small Dents\
                              o Chips in the windscreen\
                              o Rips in the Interior\
                              o Gutter Rash on the Wheels**

  **Blackvue Recorder         **o Records when Driving\
  (Front)**                   o Records when motion is sensed when
                              parked\
                              o Syncs to your phone\
                              o Optional Audio**
  -----------------------------------------------------------------------

**[Finance comparison process]{.underline}**

Open finance comparison tool

![](media/image1.png){width="6.268055555555556in"
height="3.9770833333333333in"}

**ONLY EDIT THE FIELDS IN BLUE**

**Net deduction** = Monthly cost to take home pay from quote

![](media/image2.png){width="6.268055555555556in"
